text: I was hoping I would be getting authentic Mexican cuisine. This place is another Summerlin hangout for white people who don't mind over paying for rice and beans. The settings throughout the restaurant are great. The staff is well educated about the menu. This entire place is all show and no go. I guess my expectations were too high.

Delicious food, great atmosphere here. The bar area opens up to the outside so you can either sit outside or inside with the outside shining in. I had the tortilla soup and the street tacos, both were super delicious. We also ordered the guacamole and had the house salsa. Good choices! This would be a fun place for a large group as well as just 2 people. The music they played was of good variety as well. Overall have a great time with great food!

I had a good time here, I was welcomed upon entry , escorted to my seat and offered some beautiful food (check pics from my check in below) I ordered fajitas for my entree and they offered to do double meat and it was a good portion so all in all I enjoyed it. Will return 


Pros
Very friendly staff
Good atmosphere
Good tasting food


Cons
Bathroom is a little far , very big place
Parking a little awkward but not to bad

I'm don't really eat Mexican food that often and always feel awkward ordering since I don't really know what to get. When my girlfriends wanted to meet here, let's just say it wasn't my first choice. So glad I went though. Our bartender was Sam and she was hilarious. I didn't have to stress over what to order thanks to her descriptions of the menu items. I went with her suggestion and ordered the dynamite tacos and carnitas. SO good! We went on a Friday night so the bar was a bit crowded but we never had to wait for drinks or fight for attention/service. We just ate at the bar so can't give input on the dining room but if they provide the same service as our bartender then you'll be set. Food was delish and now I'm not so uncomfortable ordering. Yay.
This is the best happy hour in Summerlin! Margaritas are on point. Looking forward to our next visit.

Food were too salty. The only that were  good were the customer service & guacamole. I ordered the steak tacos & my hubby ordered steak enchiladas. It was blah and salty...not going back anytime soon...sorry Libre but Javier restaurant won this fight.

Great service! The manager K was AMAZING! She accommodated us from table to bar. She understood they had a very busy evening but still took the time to take us to the bar to the Taco Tuesday deal which was unlimited margaritas and tacos for $25. Defiantly will come again.

If you're looking for authentic Mexican food .. This is not the place(aside from the guacamole and chips) Their food is over priced. I'm giving  them 3 stars because personnel was friendly and had good service.
Not a fan of the tacos. The steak is great but the fajita taste undercooked. The drink is amazing(Margaritas). The waiters are extremely unorganized. Having a great time tho.

One word. Loud. 

Painfully loud. Can a Brother get some soft surfaces on a wall or two to cut the sound reflection?

Granted we were there on a busy Saturday night, but I can honestly say that I've never been to a louder restaurant in my life. It was so loud that I downloaded a decibel meter on my iPhone, and it clocked in at 91 decibels. THAT'S PRETTY LOUD!...WHAT?...

Food was just OK and the margaritas were meh, but the servers were great. Very friendly and attentive...they get an extra point for that.

Next time though, I'm ordering a couple more of their teeny tiny tacos to use as earplugs.

Wow!  What a disappointment! We were drawn in by the advertising for a Cinco de Mayo celebration in the newspaper. Got there and they said there were no specials. We put our name in anyway at 6:00. They said an hour wait. We went back twice. After two hours, we gave up. We are currently enjoying a lovely meal in another restaurant. Needless to say, no call back after three hours. Never stepping foot in there again.
The top notch  staff and awesome food! If you want a fun, tasty hh theirs is the best. The tables are cozy and with the aroma of sizzling delicious plates it awesome.

I normally don't like to eat at Mexican restaurants inside casinos, because its usually not authentic Mexican food. However I decided to give this one a try since it just opened. 

I had the Tuesday deal which is unlimited tacos and tequila. I didn't care much for the tequila, but the carne azada tacos were the BEST!! The drink I highly recommend is the Desperado which is a very similar to the michelada I had in Mexico. 

Another reason why I'm giving this place 5 stars is because of their amazing costumer service. Our server was Josh Wilson and he was absolutely amazing, he's was very knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. Overall I had a great experience and I will definitely be back to try other menu items, I'm certain I wont be disappointed.
Tacos and guac is great here! The service at the bar is even better! Def suggest a margarita or one of the specialty cocktails!

To start I will say I was kind of upset about the old Mexican restaurant closing, but was excited to see what Libre had to offer. Saying that, I am more than satisfied with Libre taking over and replacing the old Merchadito. The food was amazing, and had its own little spin to each dish which made it that much better. There seemed to be a lot of employees working, which I'm sure is to be expected when opening a new restaurant even though it can be overwhelming at times. Our server/servers (Kevin), in specific, were on point when it came to knowledge of each dish, having great recommendations, and making sure we were satisfied and well taken care of. The other gentlemen, which I believe we're the bussers, were on top of keeping us happy as well! Will definitely be coming back again soon! I Highly recommend everyone to try it out!!

I like the food but HATE the customer service and hostesses. Rude!!! I have been here 2 times for happy hour when there are lots of seats in bar open (today 4 wide open and dining room inside even more) and they tell me there is a 45 minute wait. I ask why when there are several open slots. They state they are expecting reservations. Really you reserve the outside patio and bar stools? To top it off people enter after me and seat themselves without an issue. I will spread the word and not return. Now enjoying my happy hour at Hearthstone.
Had a great tacos and tequila Tuesday. Xavier was our server and was on top of everything. Would come back here anytime of the week.

Went here for the first time and it was amazing.! The food and service was great.! The people there make you feel welcome and give great service. Shoutout to Jose who was the only one that spoke Spanish, he was really friendly and gave us great service.! I highly recommend this place for anyone who is looking for a Mexican place to eat at.

One of my favorite mexican restaurants in the summerlin area ! Has great happy hours deals & super fun Taco Tuesday !  $24 AYCE and drink Tacos, tequila and margarita !!! 

Went for the taco Tuesday special and had a blast ! The atmosphere and staff are amazing ! Our server Xavier was the best so kind and attentive to our table. Our glasses were never empty and our stomachs were left full ! 

The cinnamon ice cream churro sandwich is the best dessert I've ever had ! 
10/10 recommend
First time here and food and service was awesome!!  I saw great team work from the host, server, busser, and manager. Thank you for the awesome experience Xavier! We will be back:)
I usually go for the Carne Asada steak tacos or fajitas! The service is always excellent and the food is delicious! Love  their Margaritas as well!!!

Great food and great service. We had an issue with one of our meals, but the manager, Frank, was very accommodating and completely made up for it. The food is a little pricey, but totally worth it in my opinion. The lamb barbacoa and banana wrapped pork shoulder were excellent. We'll definitely be returning.

This is the place that used to be mercadito in red rock casino. I ate the shrimp fajitas price was 24$. A little pricey for what I got. The flavors were good.we also had the rice pudding for dessert it was very good. The vibe was fun.waiter was on point .I'll be coming back.

Wow!! Yum yum yum and then some! We tried Libre for the first time and it was the most amazing dinner! So many gluten free, vegetarian and vegan options! What a fantastic surprise!

Service was top notch! Xavier was super friendly, attentive and knows the menu so well. It felt like a 5 Star Strip experience in our own neighborhood.

We had the guacamole, carnitas, street tacos, dynamite shrimp tacos, some yummy shrimp dish and tequila!

Everything was awesome and we will be back!!!

What a breath of fresh air from Mercadito!  While I enjoyed Mercadito, I never went back after trying it once...  They made you pay for chips and salsa and the portions left me feeling hungry.  I definitely felt I did not get what I paid for.  With Libre, it is an entirely different story...  While they do have salsas you can purchase, the house salsa is enough to leave me satisfied.  I was happy to hear they provide complimentary chips and salsa!  The guacamole is flavorful, creamy and DELICIOUS!  I don't know why I ever order entrees when I eat Mexican food because I am always stuffed off the salsa and guac before my meal arrives.  Boy, am I glad I did!  The chili rellanos were AMAZING - the best I have ever had!  I am going back tonight with my friends and I can't wait to try some of the different options on the menu although I am tempted to order the chili rellanos again...
Fish tacos are great!  The mahi mahi taco had really good slaw that went with them. We loved the decor and the atmosphere had such a fun feel to it.  It was a great time and great meal!

Absolutely love this place!!!! On top of the food being excellent, the service is spectacular. The ambiance is as well great. Definitely a must go to place if you haven't been yet. The street tacos were A+.
Margaritas were wonderful! The 3 salsas were great! Very quick service! We will definitely be back!

Had the lamb shank Barbados $28 - the sauce was to die for! Ate with the Spanish rice it came with. We mixed the side of habanero with the salsa. Careful! It packs a punch! 

Our server Autumn was excellent! Not only was she on top of things she's absolutely beautiful  

Others at the table ordered the street tacos. No one finished them :/. I did try a piece of the steak taco and it was well flavored but little over cooked. Although double in price the shank was well worth the visit!

I have to say that this is is a great little Mexican spot!

Service was exceptional!  The bartenders jay, Kim and Rebekah were the best!

I tried the carne Asada burrito per recommendation with the green sauce.  All I can say is amazing!

If you want a great meal come here!

My friend got the taco Tuesday special. 
All you can eat tacos and all you can drink margaritas for $24.   Best deal in town!

Not your Padre's Mexican Food. The food is fresh and eclectic with a Mexican flare. We enjoyed fresh guacamole, corn fritters, shrimp ceviche, and vegan fajitas. All were expertly prepared and delicious. They also accommodated our special orders. During happy hour (4-6pm daily) several of these dishes were just 6 dollars. Why not 5 stars?  The house margarita was just average and the service was a little jumbled.
Service was excellent, Xavier was an excellent server very knowledgable and attentive. Drinks were also excellent. Great time!

My fiancé and I came for cinco de mayo. Luckily we didn't have to wait and were able to sit on the patio. The server seemed backed up. And looked like the only one working the patio. Our drinks took a long time. Our first ordered food item came out before the drinks. But it was cinco de mayo. I'm sure they were backed up. We had the chicken fajitas, they were really good. They started us with chips and salsa. We also had the corn fritters, they were ok. We'll be back to try other food items again
Really great time.  Brandon was super accomodating and the staff was on point.  Good times.  Much better than mercadito.  Check it out

Another great meal. This time Xavier took care of us. My wife was a little tipsy, but he kept her entertained and away from trouble. We had a friend with us who is (actually) allergic to gluten, eggs, and dairy. They have a separate section on the menu for those with menu restrictions, but she has a lot. They went out of their way to make her something she could eat (and she loved it). The server told us they even have a separate area in the kitchen that handles these dishes to make sure whatever's not supposed to go in them doesn't.
Tried this place for taco Tuesday and loved it! The margaritas were very good and the tacos were way better than I expected. $25 a person is a great deal. We will definitely be back.

Our server was amazing, the food was great, we had a coupon. This would definitely be a five star review except for one thing- the guy clearing our plates seemed to hate us. He was constantly hovering and trying to hurry us along, going as far as taking our dessert forks away and trying to clear or table before dessert even came. We were initially having a blast and were literally enjoying three courses so it's not like we were being stingy and just nursing single cocktails for two hours. Feeling so rushed really made us uncomfortable and kind of dampened the mood. By dessert, we just felt really awkward. Our server was outstanding and accommodating with our slightly quirky order and the food was really really good. The odd service from the one employee was literally the only weird spot in an otherwise amazing experience!
This was my 3rd visit here. The margaritas have been pretty good each time. Tried the empanada which was good. The dipping sauce was delicious.

First I have to say the food was a 4 star+ for taste and presentation. Very yummy! Atmosphere is awesome as well! BUT- my yummy modified fajitas (nearly no oil used-lettuce cups vs tortillas and no rice/beans) was accompanied with a chicken bone that nearly broke a tooth! The manager took it off my bill-but I was still disappointed and hungry! Also my Diet Pepsi was completely flat - pet peeve-Second major problem-service! 2 star at best. Waitress was sweet but went MIA after we ordered. The other bar/tender waitress was useless and we were left waiting for easily 30 extra minutes for our check. I had to get vocal as my friend HAD to leave and she had taken her card 20 mins + and left us sitting and waiting. Finally received my friends card back but my other "date" did not receive her change/check.

Horrible service from the server.. Gerson. He was rude to us.. i asked for the menu list 2x after ordering for additional order and he never returned but  we noticed that he was always on the other table across us and was very attentive to them.. we are not dressed well since we just came from work so he just snubbed us. Won't come back again!

Libre is formerly known as Mercadito. Mercadito closed for a short period and re-opened as Libre.

The decor is a little more open and carries a them/artwork similar to Nacho Libre.

The happy hour has changed a bit and unless my eyes are deceiving me the beer is in a smaller glass at a higher price of $6 for draft.

Most of the bar crew is no longer there and I'm missing Gus and Ryan!

Kim (I think was her name) was a blast from the past as our bartender and very attentive and personable.  The ceviche was tasteful but a little small. I'll definitely come back again but I really miss the old staff.

Decided to try a new place close to home since they sent out a coupon for 15 off 45. Made a res although didn't need one, outdoor seating is first come, so we picked a comfortable couch with pillows. 

Our waiter Joseph was very nice & attentive. Helpful in swaying me to order the chicken bowl versus the tacos, which I was stuck in between. The bowl was HUGE and delish, I was able to have left overs today too. Lots of very fresh and delish flavors, The Chips & salsa are really tasty and I'm pretty selective with my chips and salsa. Must be fresh and never over cooked chips. Check and check. The Taquitos were good, a little much cheese for my liking so will try something else. My partner ordered the tacos and enjoyed as well. Ordered the Churro sandwhich for dessert & was also good. (would have preferred nutella to the choc sauce, or dark choc)

Tonight was my first time at this restaurant,hostess,& server were kind. I took a date to try it. We order the queso fundido for appetizer and well for the price,the portion size wasn't so bad but I didn't get as much as chorizo in it,the portion of the entrée was a good size,not bad for a quite mexican cuisine restaurant of course with an american twist,the only cons of this place is the music they play(am mot asking for them to play mariachi but am sure they can spicy up the environment just a lil bit),and the presentation on the plates,the beans didn't taste like restaurant made am sure they can add up FEW more plates to the menu, after all it was my first visit here,i hope to enjoy it more next time...

We truly enjoyed our dining experience.The staff was friendly and The restaurant was beautiful. Our server Tiffany was amazing!!! She had an awesome personality and recommended several dishes that we all tried and they were delicious.. we will definitely be coming back the next time we are in town. Thank you Tiffany for a wonderful dinner, we hope to see you soon.

I won't complain even if I wanted to! The waitress was super nice and kept the tacos and drinks coming our way. I got full pretty fast and wanted to take some home but felt a bit embarrassed to ask for a box and the waitress made no biggie of it and actually brought out more salsa and chips to take home while I continued to get plastered! She even gave to go cups for the margaritas to walk throughout the casino with! Best night ever!!!!
It was a nice place to have lunch after exploring Summerlin and Red Rock Recreation Center.

The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I didn't eat there. I was waiting for $1 oyster Wednesday next door. I drooped in for a beer. The bartender, Ray, was friendly and professional. The place looks like it's a great place for dining. There's a patio for dining and drinking and good music flowing through the overhead speakers. I'll definitely come back for their menu.

I came to Libre on a Taco Tuesday, and I was surprised with the quality of the tacos. The Taco Tuesday offer was $24 for all you can eat steak and chicken tacos and as many tequila shots and margaritas that you want. Chips and salsa were also complimentary. The chips were warm when they came out, which was a good contrast to the chilled salsa. The salsa was fresh and flavorful, where the notes of cilantro were evident and it was not too spicy. The chicken tacos were tasty and the bits of chicken were tender and juicy, where they were lightly seasoned. The steak tacos was the real winner though. The steak by itself was marinated very well, where the spices accentuated the natural flavors of the beef. The meat was cooked to a tender medium, where it was still able to keep its juiciness even though the steaks were cut to thin strips. 

Even if you don't like to drink alcohol, Taco Tuesdays are wonderful at Libre. You can get your fix of as many tacos you want and their chips and salsa are just as great.

Wow so I went here last night for the taco Tuesday I was amazed. The special consisted of all you can eat tacos and all you can drink margaritas or tequila shots (double shots). I was skeptical at first that they was going to be limitations and rules....there wasn't the only thing stopping me was me. I was amazed I sat down in less than 5 min my waiter was there ordered two specials and a bean dip cause we were starving and needed an appetizer...well in less than 10 min all the food and drinks were out! The service was tremendous constantly helping and very friendly. I'm so glad I tried this place! I will return!
Delicious pasole and flan. Thanks Xavier for the excellent service.

Good food in generous portions!

The fresh guacamole appetizer was awesome! The chips were fresh, and the salsa was fantastic.

I'm a fan of the "Sidecar" cocktail. I had several here, and they were on par with the best. It's sort of like a margarita made with cognac and lemon instead of tequila and lime. Try it if you like classic cocktails that go well with Mexican food!

For dinner, I had the chile relleno - deep fried and delicious! served with fresh avocado and a tasty green salsa. Really good! The accompanying rice and beans were standard. Not exciting, but fine.

All-in-all, a very good experience. I'll definitely be back.

So, why four stars instead of five? The prices. Though they are not unreasonable for a casino restaurant, I have a hard time paying inflated prices for a food that is (a) generally so inexpensive (rice and beans, right?) and (b) so ubiquitous in Las Vegas.

We're essentially in "Occupied Mexico" here. Really good, authentic, and cheap Mexican food is available pretty much everywhere in town. I understand that we're paying for the service (which was great) and the experience (which was above average) - but for me,the $60 tab (including tip)was just too much when I can get a similar meal in a less fancy place for a good deal less.

Still, kudos to the team there for killin' it!

Husband and I came out for AYCE tacos, tequila, and margaritas.  They offer 3 types of tacos with the promotion: chicken, steak, and/or pork. All are delicious. All you can drink margaritas and tequila. If you get the opportunity, ask to sit outside. The views are absolutely gorgeous. The staff does an amazing job making sure you're taken care of. This will remain on our things to do when in Vegas! Taco Tuesday all the way!

We just had quite possibly the worst dining experience ever here. 

It took a while for her to greet us, but to start, we ordered a coke, an ice tea, water, a kids water, and a margarita. The margarita showed up after a few minutes, the water for me followed that. We asked again for the kids water an assumed (stupidly) the other drinks were on their way.

We got the guacamole and the bean dip, probably the highlight of the meal.

It took her about 20 minutes to come back and get our order, and we were finally able to bring to her attention that we still didn't have an ice tea or our coke, as the guy bringing drinks was thoroughly clueless and painfully absent.

We ordered a chicken al pastor burrito, a Chile relleno, a kids quesadilla, and chicken enchiladas with green sauce. We asked if the enchiladas came with rice and beans, and were told no, so we added a side of rice (she didn't want any beans as she can't eat them).

The ice tea finally came, still no coke.

Rice comes out, alone, weird, whatever. the kids quesadilla comes out, ok, fine, baby can start eating. a little while later the rest of our food comes out, pretty quickly, still no coke.

Enchiladas came out with rice and beans, annoying because we didn't want the beans, and we ordered a side of rice and paid extra for it because she told us there was no side of rice. Her enchiladas were also smothered in red sauce, instead of green. 

My chicken burrito was beef, and tough, tendony beef at that. I cut it open and waited to start eating because I wanted to send it back.

She never came back, so my mother in law decided just to eat her wrong enchiladas, and deal with it. Good thing too she would have starved too, because the waitress never came back.

The coke finally showed up when we were well into eating our entrees (well except for me, as i was not eating, still holding on to a glimmer of hope that I would get the chicken burrito I ordered)

We tried to get someone's attention, but no one seemed to care, so I waited with an untouched plate of food in front of me.

I thought my hubby stopped eating his Chile relleno out of solidarity with me, but turned out his food was just gross. The Chile was breaded nicely but it was raw inside, and totally flavorless.

The waitress finally came by about 30 minutes after our entrees got dropped off, and everyone was done eating, except me of course, I sent the food back and just asked it be removed from the bill since I didn't feel like making everyone wait while I ate.

Drinks were never refilled.

She did take a ton of food off of our bill, even though we only complained about my burrito, she must have known we got crap service and was trying to salvage a tip.

The manager never came over, he preferred leaning up against the bar and watching his staff struggle with basic restaurant tasks.

We will never come back.

As some of the other reviewers have mentioned, in the interest of full disclosure, I was a Mercadito fan. I went into Libre hoping it would be something similar. (I was told by a friend that works with Light group, the group that owns several of the restaurants in the Red Rock, that they basically forced Mercadito out in order to place their own restaurant there).

The drinks were nothing spectacular. The server hyped up their happy hour special that was a shot and a beer for a price that "basically gave you a free beer". We had two of those specials, two cocktails, an extra tequila shot, and the ceviche taco appetizer, total came out to $80. Let me also say, thank goodness I wasn't very hungry, because the size of these tacos... Oh man... They're supposed to be 'street taco' size, but they look more like Fisher-Price toys when you buy your kids their first play kitchen. I ordered the cucumber cocktail (can't remember the name exactly) and it wasn't very good. Being a proper alcoholic I still finished it of course, but I long for my Misty's Sleeve from Mercadito! Not likely to go back judging by the size of the food versus the cost.

Ok, first things first. Leaps and bounds better than Mercadito (which was nothing but gringo fluff, latin-ish, pretentious crap). Service at the bar was great, all the girls were friendly and helpful. The menu was everything it should be, a fancy version of the real thing, not an "inspired" dish some overhyped chef invented.

The food I tried:

Pozole -  Excellent, very tasty but too small for the price. A cup size great for tasting.

Mahi tacos - Delicious, good sized plate but were sweetened with a honey glaze, I personally dont care for sweet food unless its dessert so it would be nice to know in advance.

Rice and beans - well they are rice and beans....good quality, which I will take any day over most crap out there but, but nothing special, homemade are still best. 

Coconut ceviche - I was concerned by the name it would be sweet but it was delicious, again though to small for the price. 

Chips and salsa -  chips were good nothing spectacular, but way better than most other places, Pico de Gallo was delish. 

Churro Ice Cream Sandwich - A spectacular foodgasmic messy event to cap off the smorg. 

Overall they hit the mark, they would have and will get 5stars from me if they adjust the portions to match the price. 

I complimented the manager, who was very gracious, and told him Id be back to try to whole menu, and I will.

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE, keep improving and dont let this go down the drain.
Awesome food, music, & service! The only downside was my margarita was a little on the salty side but other then that everything was awesome!

It was good but a little too overpriced, but what can you expect when it's found in a casino, that charges for resort fees, you're gonna feel a little ripped off when it comes to the bill. We opted for the taco plates, they were mediocre, still left somewhat satisfied. The guacamole with chips was excellent! I got my free margarita when I first checked-in, don't think I'll have another margarita for a while. It was an OK experience, decor was enticing but don't think we'll be coming back any time soon! I'm sure there are better places elsewhere.

Love Zach the GM & I got lucky to have both him & Stephanie from Borracha as my bartender from GVR yay!   She was heading home & got me a rosé, Melissa took over.

Been in twice for drinks so I can't rate food yet, but looks similarly delicious to Borracha's menu, except for a few dishes I'll have to try next time.  

Love the outdoor open ambience more than Borracha, wish the bar was larger, but all good cuz a small portion extends to the outside.  The Sloe Poke is way different & too sweet compared to Borracha.  Other than that, good happy hour menu.
Tried their lobster lastnight and it was terrific! Its a whole lobster, deep fried. It comes with flour tortilla rice and beans also side of butter. Even though it was deep fried it remained tender!

This review is based on margaritas and appetizers. I came with a few girlfriends and it was actually happy hour on a Sat until 6p!  The margaritas were pretty good (standard). The guacamole, salsa & chips  were delicious!   I thought our waiter was perfect. He always noticed when a new person arrived to our table and came right over to greet them and get their drink order. Price wasn't bad - but probably because it was happy hour.

Las Vegas has need a fun local Mexican Restaurant for a very long time! This place has a fun energetic atmosphere. The staff is always attentive and and happy. The food has unique twist on presentation and the food is always good! You must try the steak fajitas as they are my favorite. The margaritas are really good! Happy this place is so close with everything I wanted to see in a local cantina!

Hubby and I went to Libre last night to celebrate our 19th wedding anniversary. We were not disappointed.  We sat out on the patio because it was such a beautiful evening but walking thru the restaurant we experienced a cool relaxing vibe. We'll eat inside next time. I'm not a big margarita fan but with 2 options going on (unlimited tacos and tequila ( Tuesday only) or $6 HH margs and teezers. I decided to go with a marg. I was pleasantly surprised it did not have an overly sour taste as I experience with most margs. We ordered off the HH menu and had guacamole, corn fritters, ceviche and carne asada tacos. I'm a purist when it comes to guac just like avocado, cilantro and a little onion this is how is was served very yummy. But if your looking for tomatoes and other add ins there not there but I'd still suggest giving it a try.  The ceviche (shrimp) was good and a nice touch is that it was served with fried plantains as opposed to tortilla chips.  My only complaint is the tacos. Although very tasty didn't think it was worth the $6 price especially because it was only 1 taco for that HH price. Wonder what the regular price of a taco is?  Waitstaff was pleasant always checking on us filling our water and removing empty plates.  Patio had plenty of customers, good music playing and an overall nice vibe going. We'll definitely be back and sit inside next time waiting for a rainy day or cooler weather for that though. So we may be back in the patio before then. Also will go with the unlimited tacos and margs next time. Better deal we believe. Rated 4 stars because of what we thought to be the overpriced tacos.

Went here with family last weekend. Really conveniently located and cool decor. The food was excellent too. I feel like the servers were very nice and still getting the hang of things in a new restaurant. That's expected. The music however is why they aren't getting a 5 star. The selection is really cool, but dammmm it's too loud! And I'm not an old person, nor do I usually complain about music levels I couldn't even hear the person sitting at the other end of the table and we were at a 4 top table. I get you are perhaps trying to drown out the casino noise? But isn't that what doors and better acoustics are for? My suggestion would be just to turn it lower a bit. We can't wait to go back for the food!
The atmosphere is very fun! Good Tuesday night special! Came for a birthday party waiting on all you can eat tacos!

Went for Taco & Tequila Tuesday with friends, and we had more fun than I have had in a long time. Our waiter, Joe, was fantastic. He stayed on top of our drinks and tacos, and he was so friendly and fun. Joe made our visit to Libre more enjoyable than I could ever imagine it could be. We wound up staying almost 5 hours enjoying ourselves and receiving excellent service. Next time we visit Libre, we will definitely ask for Joe to be our server again. Joe was great, tacos were great, margaritas were great, this place is a hidden gem! We love Libre and we will definitely be returning as often as possible! Thanks for the great experience Joe and Libre!
Great tasting vegan food that is also gluten free! Friendly wait staff and hostesses. Strong margaritas and nice ambiance.

BEST FLAN IN THE WORLD!!! We never miss this place!  If we are anywhere in Vegas we try to eat here. Try to get Xavier as your server. He is knowledgeable about the food and has great recommendations. The Margaritas are fantastic!!!

Awesome food and even better service! Ask for Ezekiel and he'll take great care of you. My boyfriend and I stopped in for a quick lunch and the bar was packed so we opted for a booth. It was really nice that they honored HH at the tables too and not just the bar. We got the HH bean dip, guacamole, corn fritters, and the shrimp tacos. The complimentary salsa was great and super flavorful. Everything was great. The margaritas were great and very generous in size. 
Will definitely be back. Keep up the great work guys!!

The food was good but the service was terrible. We went here before when it was Mercadito and the service was terrible then. I wonder if they kept the same staff when they switched to Libre. It took us 10 minutes to get a menu. The menus were brought over by the server and not the hostess which was weird. But then our server would go missing for a while. We had to keep asking for water refills which is a dining out no-no for me.

A bunch of us couples had a dinner and drinks. The place is great. We had the shrimp fajitas and a Chile relleno. The chile relleno was okay, but the shrimp fajitas was EXCELLENT! The atmosphere was alive and fun. The atmosphere was upbeat and even slightly irrevent. 
The staff treated us well despite our boisterous behavior and shenanigans. We had a lot of fun!

Wasn't a raving fan of Mercadito, but it was leaps and bounds better than Libre. 

The staff and service was outstanding.  The appetizers, guacamole and drinks were good. The decor fits with the theme, but I'm not impressed with the addition of televisions all over the place. The entree foods were beyond disappointing...Less than 2 oz of carne asada in the rice bowl. Steamed and soggy fajitas. Horrible. 

It seems as if they're focused on Happy Hour, and I think that's where they would shine...We might go back for apps and a drink, but Libre is off the menu for dinner. 

This is the latest in a long line of unfortunate restaurant decisions by Red Rock. Between overpriced get-nothing restaurants, kitchen issues in the cafe and one place that won't accept the coupons or comps (YH), I'm wondering how long it will be before I move business elsewhere. Sad...

Got here for happy hour. Currently enjoying the shrimp chiveche and their house salsas. Both delicious. For the main courses we got street tacos and the vegan chile relleno. The tacos were reminded us of actual TJ street tacos (good thing). The chile relleno was different from what I've had in the past, but it was very delicious. One of the best I've ever had. A must get too are the corn fritters.

Came here Saturday night around 6pm before a movie and got in right away. First they offered us a table that was way too intimate, there was no way I could sit down and enjoy dinner with strangers 5 feet away from me so they brought us closer to the bar and wow once again they did not think of personal space when they planned the seating areas because my friend and I struggled to get on the high top chair and sit down with the little space between the chair and the table. 

The service was so FAST it was scary. They also followed high standards and kept filling my glass before I could even enjoy a second sip of water. We literally were in and out in probably 45 mins and most of the wait time being spent was them waiting for us to decide what to eat.

I had the chicken quesadilla. Presentation was perfect, quality was delicious. For dessert we ordered the churro ice cream sandwich. My friend was dissatisfied and sent hers back immediately and honestly I just finished it for the experience and I would never order it again. The churro was overcooked and with the ice cream it made it so cold and almost hard to eat as there was no warmth or realness to it. The ice cream and chocolate sauce was nice but the reason to order it was for the churro so, I shouldn't have wasted my time and sent it back as well. 

Overall I would come back and try more, nice to know that even on a Saturday night I can dine here and still make it to my movie with no problems unlike the other restaurants in the casino! If the churro ice cream and seating weren't so terrible this place would deserve more stars especially since our waitress was great.

Not exactly the experience I was hoping for.  My partner and I went there on a Wednesday night.  I do not eat animal products, so I was pleased that this restaurant has a small vegan menu.  It was happy hour, so I decided to try one of their $6 house margaritas.  Way overpriced for what you get, it's served over a glassful of crushed ice.  Based on what I saw on the menu, all of their alcohol is much more expensive than it needs to be ($6-$8 for a bottle of beer, including domestic).

My partner ordered the chicken fajitas.  Our server mentioned he could get a beef/chicken mix instead if he wanted, so he ordered that.  I ordered the guacamole with vegetables, and the veggie and tofu fajitas (which is specific to the vegan menu).

Our guacamole arrived with cheese on top, something that was not mentioned on the menu.  As we were trying to flag down our server to send it back, our entrees arrived.  (So, essentially, everything arrived at once. Not good.)  A manager came to our table to take away the guacamole.  He asked if we wanted another order without cheese; we asked if it could just be cancelled since our entrees were sitting in front of us.  He agreed.

My partner's fajitas were good, mine were disappointing.  The tofu was too soft, almost custard-like, cut into big slices and covered in what looked like buffalo sauce.  I later mentioned to the manager that they should perhaps use extra firm tofu and slice it into strips for more of a true fajita look and feel.  He said he'd mention that to the chef, though I had the impression this was more of a "yeah, whatever" attempt to come up with a response. (I could be wrong.)

When we got the bill, we noticed that the guacamole had not been removed, and that there was a $4 upcharge for the chicken/beef mix.  We mentioned this to our server, she stated that it was indicated on the menu.  We think it would have been nice if she had mentioned it at the time it was ordered.  My partner still would have ordered it, but it wouldn't have been a surprise.  We checked out a menu and it is indicated in small print, nowhere near the section for the fajitas.  Eventually, our server removed the guacamole and credited the cost of one of our meals (via a Red Rock Resort coupon), so we're thankful for that.

As for the restaurant itself, the ambiance was nice.  The decor is interesting, and it wasn't overly loud.  Unfortunately, it's not a restaurant to which I'm likely to return.
Excellent food at this place. Little trendy but service was good. Normal Mexican fare w/a twist. Restroom is on the Casino floor, was the only downside.

My husband and I went for dinner and found out it was happy hour, so why not...we were moved from inside to the outdoor bar area for HH and the service was horrible. It took forever to get drinks (a beer and a Margarita), we tried the corn fritters ---disappointment in the flavor dept, chips and queso came with about 7 chips---dip presentation was cute but another disappointment with flavor. We were there almost an hour and during that time our waiter came to us twice. We ended up leaving $42 later(drinks and 2 appetizers).
Service 1/2 star
food 1/2 star 
outdoor bar 1 star = ** stars 
We are always trying to find different spots to take friends & family when they visit.....this won'T be one. Too many other great options in the area.

We decided to try Libre after the previous restaurant Mercadito closed. When our server came I asked him if they had kids menu. He said "Right now I am taking drink orders" Asked my children what they wanted to drink... duh get them a menu first and then they can pick what they want. I asked him what tacos were  included in the Tuesday taco special... he rudely replied "these 3 tacos... THATS IT" 
It was 105 degrees in Vegas that day and the restaurant was so HOT! They left the patio door open so hot air kept the inside so hot we  felt there was no air conditioning. We complained about the heat and the server told us "I have been here since 3 pm working in this heat"  Maybe that's why he was so rude! Then a man in a suit came and asked us how we were doing and we complained about the heat and he said "OK"  No apologies and did nothing to fix the heat.
The food... it's just ok.. however prices are high for A la carte. If you did the taco tequila Tuesday special, it's a decent deal, for $24 can chose between steak, chicken or pork taco with unlimited tequila and margarita. No taco exceptions are made for vegetarian or vegan. You are forced to chose from regular menu. I ordered guacamole for appetizer that never came but was charged in the check!! 
This was a terrible dinner experience, very hot and sweaty through the dinner and a rude server.
The service was good but the salsa and margaritas were awful. I give this place 6 months.

Didn't know what to expect, it was neuvo-Mexican cuisine. I must admit that the carne asada was very tasty but by most Mexican restaurant standards, I never saw rice and beans as a ala cart item. The chips and salsa were good but the margarita was bitter/sour way beyond what you would normally expect, in fact I sent my drink back. I would suggest that someone taste their concoction before every shift.
Had a great dinner here at Libre Mexican Cantina. Food was great, service was excellent. All around a good experience.

The food was great , the service was great .. everything was amazing , the only reason why I don't give 5 starts and that I will not go back to this place regularly it's because me and my bf are fans of micheladas.. and we have had micheladas in so many places .. and we have never been charged 12 dol for a michelada which is just beer and Clamato juice .. like seriously this is just Ridiculous price .. we have never pay more than 8 dol for a michelada..
Other than that .. everything was great

Came here on a Monday night with a couple girl friends. So awesome that they have so many deals - including $1 taco Monday's (which is what we went for). I had ordered a strawberry margarita, I wanted it blended, but their blender wasn't working so I ended up having it on the rocks. It was actually just as good on the rocks as it is blended. Then I tried a mango margarita and WOW, so good. I love trying different flavored margaritas. As for the tacos, they were very good as well. I got chicken and steak, WOW again. Good flavor, they were a good amount of spicy too. Will be back!!

I was really unimpressed with Libre. Pretty expensive for what you're getting, and the food wasn't that great. 

Started off with chips and salsa. The chips were pretty good, but the salsa was not. Way too much cilantro, and not a lot of flavor to balance out the tomatoes. My wife and I decided to get the bean and cheese dip to go with it. This was alright. Didn't seem special. It was alright. If I was grading on bean dip alone: 3 stars. 

Followed this up with taquitos, which were not great. There was plenty of meat inside, but they had a flavor that was not what I expected. The meat was under-seasoned, but what what seasoning there was had a...an interesting flavor. I would not order these again. Nothing about them made me think that something was wrong with them in the sense that I should send them back, they just were not that good. Came with a side of guac, which I did not try but my wife informs me was also not good. Which is nice, because we had considered guacamole instead of bean dip, so we dodged a bullet there maybe.

Lastly, our entrées. I had carne asada fajitas, while my wife had a chicken dish in green salsa. My fajita meat was actually pretty good. The meat was well-seasoned, and well cooked. The presentation of this dish was really nice, I thought it looked very creative and was happy when it arrived. Although I'd asked for corn tortillas instead of flour and got flour; eventually they brought me the right ones. On the down side, the cheese that came out with this dish looked and tasted like the cheap supermarket mixed shredded cheese that comes out of a plastic bag. Not great, not a lot of flavor. My wife's chicken was severely over-cooked, and had the texture of rubber. The tomatillo salsa was alright, and the seasoning was okay. 

The real point about the food is that the only thing we finished was the bean dip. My wife and I only ate about half of our entrées, we left behind a lot of chicken and steak, and we left behind a taquito as well. No to-go containers, we just had no desire to make leftovers of this meal whatsoever.

Service was also not very good. I carry a water bottle with me everywhere I go, and I had it with me at the restaurant. For about half my entire meal I was drinking from my own water bottle because the waitress never refilled my drink.

And lastly, the environment of this place could use a lot of work. It's a "Mexican Cantina" and yet the music at one point was Fallout Boy from the mid-2000s. Not exactly reinforcing the "Mexican" vibe. I'm sure if you want more modern music, Mexico has plenty of artists to offer you. The table we got put at in the bar area was also really jammed in there. I had to squeeze between the table and the chair just to get in, and I had to ask the person at the table next to us if they could scoot their chair in so my wife could get into hers. Not good.

Definitely won't be back.

OMG!!!

They have  VEGAN menu! This is huge for a casino.  

The food was fresh and tasty and the service was top notch.

We had a great evening yesterday at Libre cantina at the red rock, they have  a great happy hour, and their Tuesday special all u can eat tacos and drink tequila was amazing.
Service was great and the ambiance is perfect, I will definitely come back.

I usually avoid eating at hotel restaurants off the strip if I can since I haven't found any that I really like. While looking for reviews on Mexican restaurants, we chose Libre. We decided to sit outdoors and on a Friday night there were 5 tables taken and a couple inside. I was surprised that it wasn't more crowded for a Friday night. We were there for the reverse happy hour.

The food was not bad. We ordered 3 items all off of the happy hour menu-
-nachos
-corn fritters
-ceviche 

The above food is pretty basic and so maybe a better judge of the restaurant would be ordering more complex dishes. 

The nachos didn't have much melted cheese if any which was a disappointment. It had a cotija cream on it and salsa. There was also no guacamole. I prefer nachos with real melted cheese on it. 

The reason for the 1 star is this-

Our waiter- not sure who he was because he never came back. Someone came to fill our water and we saw several men walking around in a suit who appeared to be a manager and our waiter was long gone after taking our order. 

Overly sweet margaritas.

Cockroaches!!! One crawling about 5 inches away from me as I ate. They helped us move our things but did not seem to be concerned about the roaches saying it's part of the summer heat and making excuses. Ummmm are these roaches inside too? Grosssss!!! I continued to see roaches crawling all around outside!! I felt like I'm in a third world country. I get that it's Vegas and there are roaches but I think they need to control roaches in a restaurant. Is that asking too much? 

We were charged full price for the meal which is fine if there was some concern shown about roaches at their restaurant. Nope. The man in the suit didn't seem to feel bad nor did our waiter and when addressing roaches just made excuses. The most concern was shown through the water boy. 

The only "libre" thing here is la cucarachas!

I came here yesterday for my birthday and I loved it ! They had 24$ all you can eat and drink Taco Tuesday ! Our server Gercin and Bus Boy Jake We're awesome ! Their manager Danielle came over to greet us and she was awesome as well ! The service was so quick and friendly I definitely will be back !

Cute restaurant with a nice patio.  Cool hangout but the food is just alright. Quite ordinary.  There are several much better Mexican restaurants in town so don't go to this one if you wish really good Mexican food.

Came for happy hour... Not too happy about the prices but the taste and quality of the food more than made up for it. The salsa was outstanding, not spicy but very fresh tasting. Carne asada street taco was just ok... Go for the chicken one has a slight kick and awesome flavor. Guacamole was some of the best I've had. Corn fritters were tasty and filling. Overall we will definitely be back!
My first time at libre and I had the one of the best servers. Thank you Joseph for the best service :)

Came here on a Tuesday night and it was PACKED.

We had to sit on the patio because the wait inside was 45 minutes.

All you can eat and drink tacos and tequila for $24. The tequila is terrible, margaritas aren't back though, because they mask the cheap stuff in them. Also bummed that you only have two types of tacos to choose from: chicken or steak. The steak was really chewy and both types of tacos had way too much slaw in them.

Our favorite thing by far was the guacamole and the salsa.

Our poor server was so busy so the service was less than good. He tried really hard but the patio was full and he was tending to it all by himself. 

I might come back but not on a Tuesday!
I love this place, I've got the best experience in food and service i will definitely return..
Great food and great service! Sat outside on patio and it was beautiful. Their margaritas are delicious too.

I've been to Libre several times now and it is excellent! Their happy hour is great and priced well. The guacamole is simple but fantastic! Their nachos are seriously huge and some of the best I've had. The chicken and steak tacos are seriously incredible!! The beans are some of the best I've had. Seriously can't rave about the food enough! The service has been great too. The first time I went they were really slow at first and brought me a free guac immediately to make it up.

Met up a girlfriend at Libre and left wanting a little more. First of all, they close at 10.... yes 10. Which left me alarmed from Vegas standards. We felt a little rushed for that reason. They don't offer any vegetarian tacos and their food all in all was very bland. Definitely wouldn't recommend the gauc. I had the mini tostadas, they were OK but again lacking flavor. They have margaritas for a dollar so that doesn't hurt. I'm not sure I would return necessarily.
Everything was delicious ! From when we walked in 2 lovely hostesses. Server was great. Went for happy hour & ordered so much food. I highly recommend going there!

Looking for a new delicious Mexican place in town and saw the reviews at Libre.  Our waiter was excellent, but what little food we ate was lacking. 

We arrived excited to discover that it was happy hour. Unfortunately, the prices were already very high and the happy hour menu was very small relative to other places we enjoy. Yard House's happy hour menu easily annihilates the one we so at Libre.  We opted to get a bean and cheese dip. It was not very good in my opinion. My girlfriend found it to be alright.  

Next we ordered the signature Dynamite Shrimp Tacos.  They were $15.  We received the 4 tiniest tacos I had ever seen.  I will go to places like Raku and spend some serious $ on some incredibly tasty but incredibly small dishes.  There is a place for that.  And even though these tacos were very good, a Mexican restaurant that offers happy hour on a weekend is not the place I am wanting to overpay for tiny amounts of food.  These taco appetizers were obnoxiously small.  4 gyoza-sized miniature nano tacos for $15.  

That was enough for me.  Inferior cheese and bean dip, lackluster happy hour menu, overpriced food items...We went to yard house and pounded back-to-back orders of poke nachos to finish off the night. 

I will say again though, that the waiter did do an excellent job.  And after seeing that we were not thrilled with the experience, told us about a deal they have that involved unlimited tacos and margaritas for what seemed like an amazing price. We may go back and try that one of these days, but for now, 3 stars it is.

Strike 1.  Shouldn't a Mexican Cantina have at the least, a good "house" margarita? Sent mine back. The mix was one of the worst I've tasted and I LOVE margaritas.  

Strike 2. It is a restaurant and a bar, yes?  The music was so loud that you couldn't hear anyone talk at the table without yelling.  I get good time music but really?

Strike 3. Along with an awesome margarita the salsa should be A1.  Nope, miss.

The guacamole was good.
The presentation of my mini tostada was really nice but the flavor was lacking. Won't order that again.
Atmosphere minus the too loud music was fun.
I've been twice and both times the service and the food were excellent! The margaritas are addictive and the atmosphere is great.

Their mani mahi bowl is heavennnnn.... margaritas unlimited for $10 as well? YES please. Love everything about this place I can't even explain how tasty the food is. Definitely recommend to everyone. Also has a vegan menu which is a huge plus!

The food was better than expected. We got the carne asada fajitas, some tequila, guac, chips and salsa. The salsa could have used a little more spice and I don't like seeing any red on my meat but everything was still pretty spot on and tasty. I would probably return and try out the tacos.

This taco shop is situated just inside the Red Rock Casino. It has an entrance from the outside so you can come and go without walking through the casino if you like. 

We've been here 3-4 times before, but most recently dined here last Saturday night with a group of friends. 

As a self proclaimed vegetarian foodie I give them kudos just for having a vegan menu.  Surprisingly they have 5 options on it!

I ordered the Veggie and Tofu Fajita. One friend ordered the Tofu Brown Rice Bowl another friend ordered the same bowl but with Mahi Mahi. 

The fajitas were served on a sizzling hot plate with 3 toppings to choose from: vegan sour cream, guacamole, and house made pico. The presentation was pleasing but the taste was lacking. The onions and peppers were raw and unseasoned. It appears the chef was adventitious enough to put Tofu on the menu but seemed to loose direction with what to do with it. Both of our Tofu dishes came out with the Tofu undercooked and slathered on one side with a hefty layer of what tasted and looked like Sriracha hot sauce. They were overwhelmingly spicy for even a spice glutton like my husband. The brown rice bowls were served with a very sweet poppy seed dressing that didn't pair well with the spicy Tofu, but our friend who ordered the Mahi Mahi said it was very good.  They may benefit from tweaking the vegetarian versions of their dinner entree recipes but overall put up a good effort for even having them. 

My husband ordered the Breakfast Burrito with Chorizo, Eggs, and crispy potatoes. He orders this time and time again and likes it a lot. 

They offer free chips and salsa for the table. 

Mexican Street Corn on the Cob and the Bubbling Queso Fundido are a must and were fresh, tasty, and delicious appetizers. As a vegetarian I would come back and eat a combination of these with chips and salsa.

Free margarita with Yelp check in!

Tacos Tuesday is amazing deal, if you are just having a great time with your family and friends. All you can eat Chicken and Beef tacos, all you can drink Margaritas and Tequila as well. Great deal for $25!

We had a great time, and our server was really nice considering we have a large group. I like the patio seating and ambiance of the place. I ordered the shrimp ceviche as well, because it's so good with Tequila.

Overall, I really like the place, the ambiance and the service. The food, I have to come back to try not just the tacos and ceviche. They have sumptuous food selection like I wanted to try soon.

Was staying at red rock and wanted to try something new. Came here based on the yelp reviews and I'm glad we did.  We were seated right away and they brought out chips and one of the best salsas I have ever had.  We ordered nachos as appetizer and they were amazing. They also brought it out fairly quickly.  We ordered the cane Asada burrito, traditional and street chicken and carne tacos.  Everything was Delicious.  They also brought out complimentary dessert for my birthday and a shot of patron.  I also had Mango margarita on the rocks which was really good. I will definitely be back.

My experience at libre was amazing. All the staff were welcoming, service was on point, and food was just amazing. The most I liked about this restaurant was their margarita. Their frozen margarita was so delicioussss!! What's even better is that on Friday they have bottomless marg for $10 until 7pm. I just order things from the happy hour menu like guac, shripm ceviche, and corn fritters with marg and its amazing. Must try!

My husband and l went in while we waited for our daughter st a school function. I wanted to check this place out after seeing them on Instagram. I wasn't impressed. The waitress was nice but it was slow so everything seemed a bit "off". I asked for a no salt Cadillac margarita. For $15 it better be good and it had salt and it was so so. Didn't knock my socks off. My husband ordered chicken burrito and got steak. He's never one to complain but I told the waitress... oops sorry was the response. He liked it but still you know? We will not be going back. Too many really good choices from dinner.

Libre has me sold on their delicious tacos! And they have all you can eat tacos and tequila and Tuesday's which makes it all the better.

Restaurant was very clean and service blew my expectations. 

Other than taco Tuesday I come here whenever I'm craving Mexican food!
The food is pretty bland and the prices are way too high. Happy Hour appetizer, two tacos, and a tostada added up to almost $70 for two. If you are looking for good Mexican sit-down, look elsewhere

Great time and great food! Joe rocks!! Had the Pork Carnitas, Shrimp tacos, and King crab taco's as he suggested it was amazing. Cadillac Margaritas were on point as was the music- Great Time! Thanks Libre we will see you again soon!

We came yesterday to celebrate Fathers day ,Free Margaritas: Very good . My husband  ordered steak fajitas which were delicious, I ordered queso fundido as an appetizer, It was big enough ,so I couldn't order an entrée. One of my children  ordered a steak and rice bowl which was tasty and big  and my little one ordered a Nachos from the kids' menu, and tacos, the  nachos were seriously huge. I read in others reviews about silverware and its true . We ordered desserts, but they came without spoons, I have to ask for spoons while the ice cream was melting it. In general, service was good.

Busy day at Libre on Cinco de Mayo. But great service from the backup server for filling in our main servers spot. They are aware at how busy the venue is on such day, so they take initiative to cater to their guests as best as they can.

Love this place. Chips and salsa, check! Amazing guac, check! A margarita where I can actually taste the tequila in it, check! Fun atmosphere-Mexican wrestling people brightly line the walls. Rockin' tunes. I had the taquitos which were seriously yummy. (Note to self: order again.) My gf had the carne brown rice bowl which was also seriously yummy. Nice too, to have a healthier option. Just a fun place to enjoy a laid back afternoon. Recommend!!!
Great food great vibe and healthy options also! Perfect! I had the brown rice bowl with carne asada and it was awesome! Guacamole is the best I've had. Definitely a good place to check out!
I had the carne asada and it was delicious. The meat was cooked perfect. Margarita is very good also. Our server Xavier was a total sweetheart. I will be coming back for sure.

I love this place! I always sit at the bar and order from Kim. She's gangster and never gets my order wrong. I can call ahead of time and she always saves a spot for me. Chips and Guacamole is bangin and the vegan menu is pretty decent. Love you guys you are my official local spot for life!!! Keep up the good work!
Great staff and fun atmosphere. Try the spicy margarita and the fish tacos. Best New Mexican spot in town!

The happy hour here rocks!!  $10 bottomless margaritas for the Rio Olympics is amazing. Margaritas are poured well, regular happy hour app/drink specials are really good. Haven't eaten anything that wasn't delicious so far. 
We will definitely be coming back in the future. 
*4 stars only because it's a bit on the $$$ side without the specials.  The single taco for $6 is more than I would pay for a street style taco.

Chips and salsa is soooo good . Husband had tacos and really liked them. I had the relleno and it was amazing!!!! We ordered a house margarita for happy hour and it was a house margarita. Wah, wah wah. I will come back for sure.

My boyfriend & I were looking for a new place to check out for Mexican food. Came across this since its close to us and we'd been to all other restaurants in Red Rock Casino. 

First impressions are really big for me when it comes to a restaurant. The hostess was very quiet and hardly said anything to us. She said "Hi. 2? I'll seat you." Takes us to our table, and no other words just walks away. No menus are given until the server approaches you. Server was attentive. 

They have reverse happy hour on weekends from 9-11 pm. We were there around 9 and my boyfriend took full advantage of $6 margaritas. Strong drinks! I got a frozen mango margarita (this was not on the happy hour menu), and it was excellent. 

Chips are given with salsa, bean dip & guacamole are extra $. Salsa is delicious. Full of tomatoes, spices, and a little heat. We also ordered the bean & cheese dip and it was just average and not worth $8. It was mostly mushy, refried beans with a large amount of cheese hidden in the middle. I don't think we even ate half of it. Entrees are decent. My fish tacos were full of flavor. Large amount of fish in each tortilla. Not much else on the taco that is worth fanning over. These were $14. My boyfriend loved his chicken tacos, but was not a fan of the carne asada tacos as they lacked flavor compared to other places. These dishes came with refried beans and rice, which I wish I would have known then we wouldn't have ordered the bean dip (I assumed we may have black beans or even refried beans that were not blended). The Spanish rice had a lot of flavor and were not dry like other restaurants. 

Ambiance is very modern. Darker setting with beautiful decor. Inside & outside seating. Part of the dining room is covered in a wallpaper with Lucha Libre athletes all over.

Overall an okay experience! May come back, but won't be a usual "go to" place of ours.

I have been here twice, once for unlimited tacos and tequila and another just for regular dinner and I must say, I am quite a fan of this place.  The décor is awesome and the food is the same!  The waiters are super attentive, especially during unlimited tacos and tequila!  I'll come here when I'm on this side of town but since Borracha opened near me, I will be going there more often since it is essentially the same thing.

Amazing restaurant! I came here last night for some food and drinks, sat at the bar and was serviced by Sam and Jay. Sam made me a pepino picante which was delicious!(it's like a cucumber martini) it was very refreshing with a hint of spicy. Next I ordered the steak tostada salad which was absolutely delicious! It had so many ingredients on top of which the dressing was perfect. My boyfriend had the chicken brown rice bowl which I tasted and was equally as good as mine! Wish we saved room for dessert, the churro ice cream sandwich sounded amazing!! Loved the design of the restaurant, the outdoor patio area is a nice touch too. Service, food, and drinks we're all excellent. I give this 5 stars. We will be back!!!
Great outdoor atmosphere and food! Drinks are wonderful and ask to sit in Joe's section - he's gonna make it a great experience!!
Service seemed very good. However, the food is very bland.. not much to write home about. Drinks are decent and price is good.

The carne asada nachos were great, although a bit pricey $16. The meat was very tender and plentiful, and the toppings weren't skimpy. The extremely tiny crab ceviche tacos were not worth the $12, esp since it was advertised as king crab, when it wasn't even snow crab. It was imitation krab! The very distinctive stringy strands stood out to me immediately, and the overly fake sweet taste confirmed it. You get four tacos for $12, so for $3 for one bite, def not worth it.

You do get free chips and salsa, but the salsa tastes like your standard jarred supermarket variety. I'm sure the salsa trio that they charge for is better, or at least I hope so.

One of our table mates also was not happy that her $15 lemon drop didn't come with a lemon. I mean come on, it's in the name.

Service was awful. It was busy when we first got there, but later it cleared out and it was still next to impossible to get our check. The lady who had been checking in on us the entire time was standing by the bar watching the game. And when we were finally able to get her attention, she just points at the bartender, who is two feet away and doesn't even tell him we needed service. Just telling us with her eyes that she's not helping us. Then walks away. Apparently at that exact moment she was done watching the game. To be fair, the bartender did come and check up on us once during the meal. But had no idea he was the one that was to be taking care of us after that, since no communication with us about that was made.

Check came fast after that tho...and yet another guy came back to pick up the card.

Is there a reason why all the restaurants at the Red Rock are always changing out after a few months?! The one next door is new now too.

If I'm in the mood for nachos, I'll go to PKWY Tavern down the street. The meat isn't as good, but they are huge, hits the spot and all for $10.

Been here many times and havent had a bad meal yet! You gotta go for taco tuesday, it's all you can eat and all you can drink tequila for 25 dollars! Great deal. Stop by the bar and say hi to Kim she makes killer margaritas.

Great fajitas and the bean and cheese dip
Was amazing.  Excellent waitstaff! I'll will definitely be back.

Went last night and had a wonderful experience. The hostesses and Manager were genuinely welcoming upon entering and our server Michelle was amazing. Warm bubbly personality and very attentive. Thought the Cadillac margarita was a bit pricey($15) but it was worth every penny. The best margarita I've ever had period! I had the chili rellanos for dinner which by the way, were also the best I've ever had. (Maybe I don't get out enough )light,crispy batter with a subtle cinnamon taste. A plus was that it was also gluten-free. My Mother had the shrimp burrito which was also very tasty. The shrimp were plentiful and moist, cooked just right. Definitely will be coming back to sample more of the menu.
Super nice outdoor seating. Garlicky guacamole and crushed ice in the margaritas. Excellent $6 happy hour all around.

The food was very good! We had al pastor nachos, guacamole, and carne asada tacos. Monday is $1 tacos which was an awesome surprise. Decor was so beautiful and with the perfect weather outside, we really enjoyed ourselves on the patio.

Very disappointing service. After sitting for 15 minutes we asked the hostess to tell our server we were ready to order our food and drinks. He came over and said he was sorry but no one told he had a table. He did not write our order down which led to missing a round of margaritas and the guacamole. Still that was ok since we were enjoying the space, music and food. 

Second round of drinks and the server came back with a margarita that was half full and no ice. He said "the bartender didn't want to get her strainer out. Don't worry I won't be charging you for this because it is half-assed." 

So...food is good space is pretty.

This restaurant is well worth a visit. The service was great and the manager even checked on is a couple times. I had the shrimp and steak fajitas, taquitos, and a couple margaritas, which were worth every dollar. I don't care for taquitos but they were very good even though you only get 3.

Half of the things we ordered came out wrong: from the drinks to the type of burrito. Everything took awhile to come out even though the restaurant wasn't that busy. We watched as the manager watched us as it was obvious that we weren't happy. And then he came over to us and said "here, I'll box your food myself" as if it was more special that the manager was boxing our food. He then stacked our food on top of each other, so my fathers plate of food was on top of mine and the manager was then going to box the food that is smoothed. He couldn't even apologize for the problems that happened tonight. The food was just adequate. It was nothing special but nothing horrible. The Mexican place before this was way better. Strongly encourage not to waste your time at this restaurant

Diana was our server, she was awesome. Very professional and fun! Really appreciate her customer service skills. I had the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans it was great! My friend also enjoyed her meal. Will come back, glad it's in red rock!
Food is good.  Drinks are really good. Service is the best.  Ask for Xavier he is the bomb.

Im a snob when it comes to Mexican food... and when it comes to Mexican food in Vegas, Vegas sucks! Libre is far and away the best. Carne Asada burrito with red sauce is pretty legit and I love their guacamole. Jay the bartender is as cool and as hospitable as they come. Check out Libre!

So after two separate outings I figured a review was finally deemed appropriate and how can I sum up in one word Libre? Libre you say? No, it's Libr-YAY!

As of this review I'd go as far as to say Red Rock houses the best Mexican food in Vegas (if proven wrong that food has got to be on point)! 

Before getting into the food I want to recognize the staff, which as we all know is equally as important as the food. From the hostess to the top you can feel the top notch quality they put into creating an ideal environment for all who "wrestle" their cuisine. 

During the first outing we went ham and sampled way too much, but did determine (for the humble price) the portion size well outweighed that by far. Their Mexican street corn comes with 4 cobs so sharing is certainly a possibility, but the happy tummy well you may want to share that internally. I admit I do get disappointed when I see it dressed with tajin because c'mon I go out to get something I can't necessarily get at home. Don't get me wrong it actually doesn't have a homemade feel with the abundance of cotija cheese and mayo (I was actually pleasantly surprised it curbed the tajin taste to an extent). Also on the outing was my choice of the chicken al pastor burrito which lead me to the 5 star rating: their green sauce. Total mic drop if there ever was one! As you can tell in the pictures the size is Goldilocks style (not too big or small, but just right) so Dessert can be had without feeling like you ate a Luchador! I did find the sauce for the pastor is actually one of the better ones I've had. It had a slight kick, but not overpowering and the green sauce was like a very rich cheese like after tone and that just blew me away. Equally as special was the hint of roasted pineapple for sweetness and tender consistency of the chicken itself. That is a highly recommended dish to say the least!

After a tease of shrimp from a shrimp taco my wife had during the first time there I was hell bent on getting their grilled shrimp burrito on my recent trip there and darned if that didn't walk out with the championship belt after my bell was rung. It's partnered with a pineapple salsa which I thought "oh no a recycled sauce from the burrito?!?", but no the experience was WAY different than before which I tip my sombrero to. No one wants the same experience twice (unless positive). Ha-ha. The shrimp though is far from scrimped (pardon the pun) on and between the perfect grilling and passionate seasoning packs quite the punch. Please give this a shot and you too will feel like El Jefe as the check arrives!

What I hold my head down for is not fully experimenting with their dessert menu. To date I have (much to the disappointment or our waiter and my wife) I chose the traditional Flan. Sorry if I'm a Flan connoisseur and don't follow a crowd when picking my meal, but next time for sure I am attacking the immensely popular cinnamon churro ice cream sandwich. As far as Flans go it was good, but to be fair I was not blown away by it (pains me to not be more impressed). The consistency is a bit thick and more mimicked the Flan my mother in law makes, but I personally prefer a softer Flan. I didn't quite taste kiwi, but was actually glad I didn't since I don't see why that'd be in a Flan (and that's even being an advocate for kiwi). All in all it was still a tasty way to wrap up the meal don't get me wrong, but their claim to fame is the ice cream sandwich so fine I'll conform on my next visit.

Whether it be plane, train, or automobile cruise over to Libre and you too can sway those hips to an A+ meal and exquisite culinary wonders!
1st time here and it's taco tuesday.  That means bottomless tacos and margaritas for $25. The interior is very nice and they have outside seating.  The hostess looks like a supermodel. Fun times.
Come see Xavier at Libre Mexican Cantina.. He  recommend my new favorite appetizer (Corn Fritters) and made our first visit to Libre memorable. We'll definitely be back.

Had after work dinner and drinks here this evening and I must say...

The cocktails are definitely worth trying. I had "The Heated Moment" and I couldn't get enough! Perfect combination of sweet and spicy.

I am a huge fan of restaurants with a Vegan Menu and although Libre's is short and sweet, it packs a great punch! The options were just what I was looking for, and the portions are huge! Enough for a second or third meal.

The service was a bit slow, coming in at 730 I expected that, however the management really made up for it as she took the time to greet each and every table to make sure all of our needs were met. Our server was polite and patient and made a great impression overall. 

The only reason for the four star rating is the fact that I am serious about my Mexican Corn. I feel that for the price they were offering it at, the portion and the taste did not compare.

Otherwise... this is a fantastic place to go for drinks, food, and friends. =]

If you're on a mission to find the best tacos in Las Vegas, be sure to stop here. I had the carne asada steak traditional tacos with a glass of beer and it was top notch. I sat at the bar and they treated me like a king. Fast service, great atmosphere, and amazing food.
Great atmosphere, engaging and knowledge staff, flavorful and generous portions would definitely recommend

Great food / Excellent Outdoor Seating / Super Service - Xavier was great!

Great place with the right music volume that helps the conversation.

If you thought Mercardito was bad -- this place is worse!  $100 for hubby and I to have dinner at a Mexican restaurant -- no meat in the chicken tamales (which were also weird SWEET corn mesa!) and the steak tacos were so salty that they were barely edible.  

With yummy, local Mexican food (at much more reasonable, less touristy prices!) within a few miles, I give this place 6 months, which sucks because the patio would be a wonderful place to hang out for locals and tourists alike!
Excellent meal on a Sunday afternoon.Great service, awesome food and the beer was cold!
Nice atmosphere.  Fair prices for being located inside a resort.  Monday is $1 tacos!!!!

Had dinner here tonight. Fajitas were great and the double up meat for only $4 extra was awesome. Could have easily shared this with another. My wife loves the shrimp burrito and the server Joe was great. Guacamole could have used a little more kick but the house salsa is fantastic.

Came here for my first time for my friends birthday and our server Joe was absolutely amazing! About 20 of us came for the all you eat and drink and right off the bat he started us off with shots cause he knew exactly why we came. Then came the margaritas and even more shots. The tacos were good but honestly I came for the alcohol! Overall Joe made it such a great experience and he was so patient with us too. Thank you! Definitely will be coming back :)

Over priced for just decent food. Don't get get me wrong I'm not saying the food was terrible, it's just average for the money. Staff was very nice, and the facility itself is great. But of course a restaurant is only as good as its food.

This is my second visit here because I believe in second chances. The food is not terrible...but it isn't good. Here's the scoop on this meal...the chicken in the quesadillas was excessively salty. My fish in my Mahi Mahi bowl tasted fishy/previously frozen. Prices are a bit high for Mexican but I'm willing to pay...especially for good Mexican....sadly this isn't good Mexican.  However the trio of salsas that I was given when I asked for hot salsas was quite nice! In fact, the tomatillo salsa although mild has a rich slightly roasted flavor. The habeñero salsa, unlike most, went beyond heat and added layers flavor often forgotten when it comes to HOT salsa. All of this means there's talent in this kitchen but perhaps they are stretched by financial limitations? Not sure....
The atmosphere is hip and kinda fun. I'm not sure how the full price margaritas are as I was here on a Thursday where $5 margaritas are on offer. If you want a cheap margarita...go for these. If you love a hand crafted, no sweetNsour margarita...pass on this. If you want elevated, creative, delicious Mexican at the same price, go to El Dorado! The classiest, tastiest Mexican I have had in Las Vegas! #ElDorado
