I might give this place one more try someday. I'm at Red Rock often and LOVE to support local restaurants. I wish this group luck in 2018! Don't give up...Mexican food is always worth it!
Great food and great happy hour!  Joseph was a wonderful server and was very accommodating to our need.

My friends and I come here all the time on Tuesdays for All You Can Eat Tacos and Tequila! You can't beat that deal, it's only $24. The tacos are street style chicken and beef && they bring them out in large quantities so you have them all out on the table for you to eat as much as you can! My favorite are the margaritas! House margaritas w the salt on the rim! They're pretty strong but still delicious! They're also unlimited and so are the tequila shots! We've had different servers every time but they're all amazing. They're all enthusiastic and the vibes are great there

We love this place. Always come with friends for their great Happy Hour. Most recently we were there and had exceptional service by our server Joe. He was friendly and kind. If you are anywhere near Red Rock Casino definitely stop in.

We came here on taco tuesday. This place is my new favorite mexican restaurant in town. I do not live too close by but it is worth the drive! As soon as I walked in I was greeted with smiles by the hostesses who were amazing and attentive in helping me find a table for my friend and I. The red haired hostess was so sweet to us helping us move to a different table and accommodating our requests even though her and the other hostess seemed very busy. The great service doesn't end there, our server, food runner, and two busters were very helpful and attentive. We ordered dynamite shrimp tacos which were to die for and also both did the $24 AYCE deal which was so worth it. The margaritas were perfectly sweet and strong, just how I like em. I would recommend this place for a different spin on Mexican food along with amazing guest service!

Popped into Libre Mexican Cantina at Red Rock Hotel and Casino before outer movie and was surprised to find an offer for free margarita upon check in 4/5. The lime margaritas were good but lacked much alcohol. FYI on Thursday's they have $5 margaritas all day, these are made well ;-) 5/5. We ordered a couple appetizers and started on the chips and salsa that was quickly delivered to the table when we were seated. 

The appetizers included bubbling queso fundido which includes chorizo, soft tortilla, and cherry tomato pico. At first this was good but the cheese became rubber like quickly (about half way through the dish) 3/5. The other appetizer was the bean and cheese dip which we poured some of the salsa in to give it some spice 5/5, good to he last bite / or scoop of the chip! Very pleasant staff and overall good food and drinks. Thanks for a quick bite to eat with good drinks.
The food was really good! Guacamole was really good - salsa was yum! The service was fine - but his place is super LOUD!  It is really hard to hear and carry on any conversation.
The food was so so. The margaritas were the worst we have ever had at a Mexican restaurant. The server was attentive. The kicker was having to pay for the sour cream. Shrimp was wayyy salty too.

Love it! Always great food and service! It's a great place to mingle with friends! However, the service tonight (4/24/2018) was not good at all. The waitress, Katia, was somewhat snobby and inattentive. We had to ask 2-3 times EACH time for the status of what we ordered. It's understandable that it was taco Tuesday, but for her to deflect blame to the bar or the kitchen by saying "it's my fault it's the kitchen" is rude. I love this place but tonight was not the best experience.
Guac and margaritas are the best in Summerlin! Unlimited tacos and margaritas on Tuesdays also means I'm here all night

Really fantastic salsa, guacamole and margaritas! Check in on Yelp for a free marg! 
Jared and Xavier have fantastic customer service and on top of everything around them.

Meh, it was ok. There are other Mexican restaurants I would choose in town over this one. The service was great, that part was 5 stars!! However the food not so much... bland and nothing really exciting going on. We were with a party of 6 and no one was overly excited about their dishes (we all got something different too). Oh well.

Super Fun Spot ! Super Affordable ! we went there for a friends birthday and had a blast! $25 all you can eat tacos and shots/margaritas, Come on who can beat that ! Joe Our server was awesome, very nice and on top of all our orders, atmosphere was perfect and food was on point ! Def recommended !

Nice enough atmosphere. The service was wonderful, though. I really like the resort so maybe I'll give this place another try after they've been open a bit longer and able to better establish themselves.

So first off I have to say it's hard for me to give anything 5 stars, you have to really go over the top for me. I came for the pre opening dinner with some coworkers and must say that the restaurant came out great. It's a nice transition from Mercaditio. This was a pre-fixed menu so we got what we could. 

-Guac on point traditional style
-Chips tasted fresh
-Salsas were all good, but the house was so crisp and fresh, excellent!
-fundido was tasty but must be eaten quick before it hardens up! 
-meatballs were different. The sauce had a strong presence of what tasted like cumin or mace. So if that's not your thing, you won't like them! 
-I had the al pastor chicken tacos, strong on the cilantro and onion, but the chicken was seasoned nicely and fairly juicy. 
-corowrkers had the enchiladas and loved them. 
-dessert, churro ice cream sandwich with caramel. That was creative and delicious! 
-margarita was ON POINT. Not too much sour or tequila, literally leveled each other out, I was very happy!

Hostess were dressed nice and very polite. Sever was knowledgable and very friendly. Little mix up when delivering plates, but this was after all their way to work or all the kinks. I'd say for just opening, everything turned out really well. 

Theme is neat too, like a nacho Libre setup. 

Overall 4 stars, def worth checking out!

To start, we were told the wait was 30 minutes to an hour, which was understandable because it was taco Tuesday. But we also asked to be seated outside and when they were ready for us, they sat us inside. Then the server wasn't the nicest either and mentioned that they closed soon and seemed to be rushing us. We tried to get the taco Tuesday deal with vegan tacos but they said they didn't do that. Not totally a bad time, but wish it was better. The food we had was good, but too pricey for how mediocre it was. 
Might go back.

The service was good.  I felt that the entrees came out a bit too quickly.  We barely had our drinks before they were there.  Food was average.  We had guacamole and the regular salsa.  Maybe the specialty salsas are better.  Not very much flavor on the regular salsa.  The guacamole was good but not sure why this was garnished with cheese.  I had the chicken pastor tacos.  They came with cheese and some creamy sauce on them.  While the flavor of the chicken was good, wish the menu would have mentioned the cheese and cream sauce so I could have asked to have this left off.  Didn't add to the dish at all.  My husband had tamales and liked them.  I felt this was pricey for the quality of food.

Knocking off a star after my experience today. Not earth shatteringly bad, but just poor service...again. We came with another group, but this time it was only about 10 people. This time they did not have any record of our reservation. I guess the hotel takes the reservations when the restaurant isn't open, so it must have gotten messed up because of that. As always, we were told that they could do separate checks. Half of our bills were incorrect. My bill was only $2, so I should have just been happy about it, but like an idiot, I had to be honest. We told the server about the incorrect bills, so he took them and left for a while. When he returned, he gave us a single bill and basically told us that we had to figure it out. He was nice about it, but it is in poor taste to make it on the customer to figure out their mistake. The Manager didn't even come to apologize. Look, I get it. It can be a pain to do separate checks. If you can't do it, or if you don't want to, just say no. That way, we know it's up to us to figure it out from the beginning. If you have a group of 6 or more, don't come here. If it's just a you and someone else, it will probably be fine. I've been here 3 times with a group of 8+ and there has always been an issue with the service. I won't be doing that again. No good deed goes unpunished!
Great service great food great drinks. I don't remember our waiters name but he was familiar with the menu and his service was on point. Especially with out rambunctious group!

The margaritas, chips and guacamole, and the Mahi rice bowl were all delicious.  The downside was that they are a little pricey.  Their posted Happy Hour specials seem like a good deal.  We will be back :)

Just left this place & all I can say is wow! Awesome service, awesome food, awesome environment. And shout out to our server, Vicky. She was on top of her game, super attentive. Definitely coming back.

Overall excellent experience with high end authentic Mexican food. We were able to make same-day reservations from very gracious hostess. Food was excellent with fresh ingredients, a variety of salsas, and homemade guacamole. Chicken burrito was made with tender white meat and an excellent sauce. Chile rellano was excellent, perfectly cooked, and great flavor. Service was good and prices very reasonable. Dinner for two with 20 percent tip only about $50.  Highly recommend.

Update:  Although I still have issues, I will say that I went back last night for an event and after sampling different foods than my first visit that my opinion has improved slightly.  The carne asada street tacos are very good, with a lot of kick and flavor and the meat very tender.  I also tried their shrimp ceviche and it proved to be very fresh and delicious, and is definitely a go to appetizer.  Their specialty salsas are great, having the smokiness and heat that their complimentary salsa is lacking.  Still not sure that this will be the place I crave the next time I'm wanting Mexican, but I certainly will give it another go in the future.

I made a reservation to come in for my boyfriends birthday. We've never dined here so we walked through the patio and a group of servers just stared at us as we tried to find a host stand. The hostess was nice but neither her nor our server gave any birthday wishes when I specifically put it in the notes.  
The food was ok, nothing spectacular. I feel like it was a bit pricey for what you get. I work in the strip so I understand paying for an experience or for a view but we were sat right next to the kitchen and heard every server conversation going on. 
Overall I don't think I will be back. From the lack of customer service to the food runner delivering our appetizer and food to the wrong table admitting he doesn't know his table numbers is not the dining experience I expect to have.
Awesome atmosphere and the best margaritas! The staff is professional and very accommodating. Definitely a place to visit while in Summerlin at the Red Rock casino!
Food was ok, not much taste to it..  Salsa tasted like out of jar.  Chips sucked!  Mercadito was way better when I visited last year.

Start to finish on point! Chef Brian Massie does it again. Clique Group hits another one out of the ball park. GO tomorrow! go this weekend! But GO!
The service the food the music! and it's not too bright and not too dark. The chips are light and clean not thick and yellow and greasy like most Mexican places around. They don't make you feel too full to eat anything else. The shrimp tacos are great. The ceviche was perfect! All of the food is really good. I liked it because at no point did I feel stuffed. Clean and tasty. First Class service. 
It's gonna be a fun spring on the patio at red rock.
José made our meal a delight.  His suggestions we're right on!  We will definitely be back!
Had amazing service today ! Got seated right away , our server Luis was great . Had the bean and cheese dip and the carne asada burrito topped with green sauce was to die for ! We'll be back soon

It was ok. Food was Nothing special. Would I go back? Sure if I'm at red rock and want Mexican. Otherwise , no I would not go out of my way to eat here. There are much better Mexican restaurants within a 20 minute drive.
Xavier was amazing. His recommendation was spot on. Service was fast, drinks good and female servers attractive. What else can you say?
The happy hour offers great reasonably priced options.  Tacos are yummy and service was fantastic.  Chicken nachos were fantastic! Would definitely want to go back when back at Red Rock

It's aight. 

Libre is an "upscale" Mexican cantina located in the Red Rock resort, and the food is good, but the price is a tad high. I came here after seeing a movie and decided to try this over Yard House. We shared the bean and cheese dip and an order of fajitas with lettuce wraps, $22 for the steak fajitas and almost $9 for bean dip. 

The steak fajita flavor was good, but it was a little on the salty side. The veggies were still crisp, and the steak was tender, this is a great option for sharing. The lettuce wraps needed to be doubled-up to hold the hot food, but when you're trying to be healthy, you can't scarf down three or four tortillas. 

The bean dip was... well bean dip. Not sure how they make it, but I have a feeling that "Tostitos" might be behind that chef's jacket. I normally hate it when people complain about price in their reviews, but when you charge $9 for what taste like canned bean dip, you got some splaining' to do. 

Like I said the food was good, but not enough for me to drive back to this side of town. I did get a free margarita with my Yelp check-in and which "liberated" me of feeling too bad for the price of food.

This Restaurant like all of the Restaurants at Red Rock   (With the exception of Lucille's and Yardhouse) SUCKED!! The Carne Asada street tacos were sour and the meat was extremely tough and very poor quality!!!. The horrible tasting  chips and salsa showed up well after the meal. Our guacamole had to be cancelled because we received our food prior to the chips and salsa. Skip this place and go to Taco Bell!!

Have enjoyed the 2 dinners I have had at this restaurant. The food is fantastic and I really like the artwork that adds character to the walls. Can't wait for it to cool off in Vegas so I can sit outside on their patio.

The happy hour was amazing! The bartender Jonathan was very helpful and very friendly! He provided top notch service and great recommendations. The food was also very delicious! My wife and I will soon return for our next vacation in Vegas for sure! Thanks Jonathan!

The transition of this restaurant to Libre is a very welcomed change - it is well appointed and comfortable, both inside and outside, and the new theme is playful.  The service is friendly and attentive, but most importantly they are well informed.  Our server knew the menu backwards and forwards, and they made us some great recommendations.  The Crispy Dynamite Shrimp Tacos and the Street Tacos Al Pastor were highlights, and we were happy with all of our choices.  When we left, happy and full, we were thanked with the same warmth as when we had arrived.  I highly recommend a meal at Libre.

Far exceeded all of my already high expectations. Great food. Great, friendly service. Options to be seated with your back to the TVs. Festive atmosphere. But it was really the care and attention of the wait staff that makes this place stand out. Exceptionally well managed.

Xavier was so hospitable and made our experience delightful. Drinks never hit the bottom and was attentive to any needs. Make sure to ask for Xavier, whenever you , he will make the Libre experience one to remember.

My boyfriend and I had been wanting to try this place for a while and we finally made it in. We were quickly greeted by the hostess and were seated promptly . Our waiter Xavier was excellent, he had a very upbeat attitude and was super attentive. He recommended the tomatillo salsa for my enchiladas which I'm glad he did because they came out perfect, not too spicy but just right. We will definitely come back.

We came for a birthday and stayed the night at the red rock. There has been quite a few different places in this location. We've tried most of them.. but so far, this is the best. 

Their service was impeccable. Our waters never ran out and our food came out hot. They forgot my vegan portobellos but it wound up working out. I forgot to ask for them to be in lettuce cups instead of tortillas so it was a win/win. They were amazing!! I will definitely be ordering them again... full of flavor and spice! 

They have an amazing happy hour. We wound up doing bottomless margaritas for ten dollars. Our server let us do a mix of tequila shots and margaritas. This wound up being so worth it. Their guacamole was delicious... beware that it comes with cheese sprinkled on top... even though it isn't listed in the menu. We sat outside and it was beautiful. I would definitely recommend coming here for a night out. Check out their happy hour!

My friends and I came for Friendsgiving because they advertised $25 open bar. They didn't mention a 2 hour time limit and they cut us off at about 1hr 15min... I didn't mind the time limit, except that it wasn't advertised in the ad, they didn't tell us when we arrived, and the drinks came really, REALLY, slowly... plus we came to watch the Golden Knights game, which didn't end til 10, so it really wasn't worth coming here. Our server David was actually really awesome, he was SUPER nice and he brought us out an extra round when he was told that he had to cut us off! But overall, it was pretty shady from management. Food was good, drinks were good, but that part was pretty lame.
****edit**** we toldthe manager about this and he brought us out two pitchers of margaritas!

Great atmosphere with a great service, nice outdoor patio, friendly staff. Food are really good specially the sizzling fajitas and the drinks at the bar are the best specially the house margarita. I highly recommend this place so come and enjoy.
Tried this place for the first time on a Sunday, just a half hour before closing (didn't know it). The good was good !
Atmosphere was awesome! Food and drinks were great! Our server Joseph was on top of it and did a great job! I will definitely be back

Listen... I am always open to trying out any kind of Mexican spot that has a good happy hour okkaaayyy?! I have made it a mission to spot out any and every one of them that can be classified as decent for me and my co-workers to go and enjoy great food and drinks. Finding places that have happy hour available on Saturday's can be a challenge just because there are soooo many that only offer on the normal Monday-Friday time period.

This past weekend my crew and I had the pleasure of heading over to the great Libre Mexican Cantina which is located inside of the Red Rock Hotel & Casino! I did some research on some of the places in my area that offered happy hour on Saturday's and come to find out I had actually already had this place bookmarked so why not right? When I arrived I was pleasantly surprised that there weren't very many people! This past weekend was super windy and slightly chilly but nothing crazy. I love places that offer patios to sit back and relax on while enjoying the drinks. 

When I arrived, I happened to be one of the first out of my group so I was told to pick actually anywhere out on the patio to sit and a serer would be right with me. The service here was actually really good and that always goes a long way in my book. A young lady greeted me and brought out my water just to start. Now at the time, they were offering a free house margarita with check-in so I also added that into the ordering rotation as i waited because were cutting happy hour kind of close . From my experience the check in margaritas at most places are either way too sweet or just not good at all since it is free. That was NOT the case with Libre! These margaritas were AMAZING and STRONG! YES! This is what I call a happy hour. Now it was time for ordering! The food is limited as far as the selection goes on the menu but literally everything we tried was delicious. We ordered damn near everything on the Happy Hour Menu:

Guacamole: Cilantro, Sweet Onion, Jalapeno

Chicken Nachos: Pickled Onions & Jalapenos, Arbol Sauce, Sour Cream

Mexican Street Corn Fritters: Cotija Crème, Poblanos, Grilled Corn

Cheese Quesadilla: Crispy Flour Tortilla, Mexican Cheese Blend

Shrimp Ceviche: Kiwi, Lime Mojo, Crispy Plantine 


Once the rest of my crew showed up, they followed suit and checked in and requested their drinks as well. We ended up double up on drinks so at one point we had about 8 margaritas coming out. Our server changed again and we got a really nice guy who was training another server so at this point we didn't know who to tip lol. Everybody was great! We will make this one of our new favorite Happy Hour spots for SURE!

The Traditional taco plates are great. 3 taco's soft or crunchy, beans & rice. And during December, Monday-Thursday, they are 50% off. They put plenty meat. They were out of Coors Light draft the night we went. So the Manager-on-duty went next door and got me one. No charge. That is what a manager should do and they should empower their 'line' employees to do the same. This place is in Red Rock Casino. So go have dinner and see a movie.

Great little spot to come in and enjoy a margarita at happy hour.

I used the Yelp check-in for my first margarita on the house which was really nice. I opted to go with the beef empanadas from the happy hour menu which was only 6 bucks and an entree of the chicken mole.

The beef empanadas was flaky and savory with a little hot sauce dipping cart on the side. Also to start where they bring you a massive bowl of salsa and chips which tasted fresh and a tiny bit of kick.

The chicken mole was very interesting. Everywhere I have tried this dish in Nevada restaurants it is more sweet than Savory and spicy but it was a nice version of it for sure.

The service here was top-notch and he made sure my drinks were flowing so aces all around.

Overall, an enjoyable experience. If you check in you get free chips and guac which were over all good, not the best I've ever had, but had a decent flavor and were fresh. I had a Cadillac margarita to start and it was so so, again not the best not the worst. My husband and I shared the carne asada nachos and they were SO good. Cheese on every bite, some kind of spicy queso sauce that was to die for, I only wish it had a little more meat on it. Next we had micheladas which were very good, just ask for extra limes and extra tajin and you are good to go. The service was okay, we sat at the bar, the bartender was very nice and attentive as she could possibly be, they were also very busy. But, my drink never ran empty and she checked frequently on us.

Now that I have had some time to think about my dining experience let me elaborate on my 1 star rating. 1st,  5 star reviews are reserved for THE NEAR PERFECT dining experience. Anyone who gave this place a 5 star either a) works there or b) has very low dining standards. 2) I wish there was 0 stars. This place is a sorry excuse for a Mexican restaurant. Bagged Tostitos for chips ? Come on they aren't even trying. Food was terrible, I had the mahi tacos which were dry and flavorless. I asked for no Pico as I am allergic to cilantro and was given tacos with Pico on them. It took an hour to get our food so i didn't bother sending them back. My husband got a burrito that was smothered in a sweeter than sweet red sauce, it was near inedible. I ordered a raspberry lemonade and was given an iced tea. 
I understand that this is a completely different restaurant than the former mercadito. However what is truly unfortunate is that they replaced a true 3 or 4 star Mexican joint with a sad, wannabe, restaurant and didn't even try when it comes to the food. Again BAGGED TORTILLA CHIPS. Need I say more ? But I digress , you want the best tacos in all of Las Vegas? Just go straight to Tacos El Gordo .

GOOD food, good service, we will be back. 
(Shrimp burrito with green salda) you have to try it.
Best deal at red rock. All you can eat tacos and tequila for $25. Good tequila and the bartenders made a great mango margarita. All around good service and clean atmosphere

Came here for date night tonight and I must say, I was highly disappointed. If you're looking for authenticity, this isn't the place for you. The food was definitely Americanized "Mexican" food. The rice tasted as if it came from a box and I believe there was mayonnaise in my "traditional" tacos. The portions were lacking and highly overpriced, but then again, it is a restaurant in a casino. And the service? Left much to be desired. It took at least 15 minutes after being seated for the manager to realize we had been sitting there without a server even saying as much as "hello", let alone taking our orders. It wasn't outrageously busy for a Friday night and our "server" (didn't even get his name, as he failed to even introduce himself) was so busy checking on every other table, it seemed like he couldn't be bothered with ours. Ridiculous. Don't waste your time or money.
The service and food at libre is outstanding!  We got the shrimp burrito with green sauce and cheese enchiladas with green sauce.  They were two of the best mexican dishes we have ever had.

Ok this place used to be called Mercadito (cute Spanish word for Market) placed inside Red Rock. I'll tell you I loved it! For one, they had a nice selection of fresh tacos, even had the taco of the month. Their civiche was amazing, and the guacamole was out of this country amazing. I also loved that on Tuesdays they had industry night and gave a 50% discount (eventually coming down to 30%) but still, a highly recommended, fun and delicious Mexican restaurant.

So what happened? It closed down and was renamed and revamped. Apparently a new company or owners took over and added this weird art. My problem is the menu. All of a sudden they have Fajitas? I like faijtas but why change a menu that was popular?

This place would get packed back in 2015, we had to wait 40minutes but we knew it be worth it. So we walked in, on a Tuesday and was surprised to see it was kinda slow. And even more surprised to discover the menu was petite and the flavor wasn't out of this country. 

I'm conflicted, it's not that it tasted bad, and it's not that it's overpriced and I miss my discount. It's just not impressive anymore. The guacamole is ok, my girlfriend had some Mahi tacos and they were served on flour tortillas and she wasn't going crazy for them like before.

I miss my jalapeño Mexican Mac+cheese, and now there's nothing exciting to order.

In the end, it's worth a shot for just having a margarita and some chips and guacamole if that's your thing. Just bear in mind the food isn't anything to rave about.

Went last Saturday to celebrate my birthday with family and sat outside on the patio. Nice patio but the couch we sat on was dirty. Ok no big deal, I understand they can't shampoo it everyday. We were kind of tightly squeezed, so we asked our server if we could move the empty table next to us down and connect them and he Said , "yeah", and he walks way and doesn't even do it for us, my elderly father had to get up and do it himself. So we were there at happy hour , it started at 4:00 , and it was 4:05 and we had no happy hour mentioned or no happy hour menu from our server that took our drink order. My mom asked if we could see a happy hour menu and the bus boy Said "it's not happy hour", so my mom Said "Well when does it start" and he Said "at 4:00" my mom said "its  4:05" . He then brought us the menus. We ordered 6 appetizers. At this point I never got my Pepsi , so I mentioned it to our server and he was such a smart ass, he Said "you'll get your drink, don't worry",with a huge attitude! I was embarrassed, so I said "oh it's not a big deal, when you get a chance". He walked away and I looked at my mom and said, "oh this is gonna be fun"! So he brought the Pepsi and we got our appetizers. They were fine, no problems with them. He came around to take our dinner order and We all ordered fajitas , we were four people and he said they were big enough to to split, so we ordered two orders. He said if you pay and extra $4 they give you extra protein, lol, yeah right, we literally received two chunks of the mahi mahi and about 6 strips of steak! This was for both., like 4 tortillas for Both as well. No rice and beans at all, I mean for $26 you'd think you would get rice and beans included! The fajitas, I mean I have had better at many less expensive Mexican restaurant, the steak was dry, the flavors were sorta bland. The waiter had kind of an attitude the whole time, so I was afraid to say anything . We then ordered 2 desserts and split them as well. We never got drink refills unless we asked for them. What has happened to customer service? I was telling my mom while we were eating that there is no such thing as good customer service anymore, she said "yeh I never expect it, so I'm not disappointed". We spent about $130 between the two separate checks we had and it was so not worth it!!
Xavier is the best server!!! Good food better margaritas!!! Try the shrimp and jicama tacos, and the churros.

My first time here and the service was okay. Our waiter did not let us know that the second order of guacamole was another charge. I thought it came with the salsa and chips. I enjoyed their margaritas.

Fantastic service service and food! Our server Joe was extremely helpful in suggesting guest favorites and steering our choices. The street tacos were amazing and they came out in a timely manner. Also had the churro ice cream sandwich, which really hit the spot. I definitely will be back for that amazing taco Tuesday deal!

Stopped in for a quick bite on Friday night before a concert. Grabbed a seat at the bar. Ordered the chips and guacamole because it was free with check in on yelp. And ordered Chicken cheese quesadlilla. The chicken and cheese quesdilla was light and flavorful. The tortilla was flaky and buttery...almost too greasy. But was good. It had a flakiness that reminded me of a crossaint. Again it was good/ok. It was a little salty but I would probably order it again. The guacamole and chips also came with salsa. More than enough for 1 person. The salsa was very chunky and had hints of spice, lime and cilantro. Very good salsa imo. The guac was just mashed up avocado and had no real flavor. Service was great and atmosphere was great.

First time we came here it was phenomenal spot on, staff , food solid 5 stars wished I reviewed my experience . This time around maybe not so much . We were greeted kindly coming then felt like we're left as soon we got a table I think we were waiting for 10 mins trying to see who would serve us I guess we were forgotten. Till I raise my hand an the curly red lady came to us . She seem dissatisfied with us . Like she wanted to take our order and never come back . Wait she did .. after getting food we felt the food was not like taco Tuesday let's just say very much a "no bueno" . We ordered a side of rice and Sprite never came . Another server took our order for that we got sprite never got the rice . Our original server circled and circled checking on everyone but us . Finally after done eating she came by quietly without saying nothing pour some water in our cups and left again . She disappeared again for several minutes we asked another server for the check. Me and my girlfriend were very unsatisfied and probably reconsidering we should only come on Tuesday because it seems like no one cares who you are here any other day . I left no tip.

Really wanted to love it but the food was bland, really lacked any distinct flavor. So if you're a fan of mild America Mexican food you'll enjoy this. Just not for me. I'd come again if in a group and its happy hour. Margarita was tasty.
2nd time at Libre's! Amazing high quality food and awesome service!! Gerson is awesome!!! Definitely my favorite restaurant here in Vegas.

The food is pretty good. This is the 2nd visit here. Very disappointed that the waitress rushed us as soon as we were seated, like a fast talking sales woman she talked us into the bean dip AND guac, not knowing until the check came that it was $8/each! Girl, bye. Never coming back.

Loves the all you can eat tacos, but I turn 21 next week so I'll have to come back to enjoy the all you can drink tequila and margaritas my friends got... loved the ambiance and it was the perfect weather to sit outside. Definitely worth it, come with an appetite!
By far one of the best locations around for quality Mexican food! Came here on there taco Tuesday special and had a great time ! Can't beat the 24$ all you can eat and drink tacos and tequila !

Once upon a time, this restaurant was Mercadito, home of "sex mex" -- their words, not mine.  And now it's Libre -- another trendy Mexican restaurant with a new menu and new decor. 

Appetizers: Dinner kicked-off with a complimentary bowl of tortilla chips with a side of mild salsa, but we also ordered the Bubbling Queso Fundido. A hot skillet of cheese topped with a small scoop of guacamole, some pico de gallo, and what I believe were pickled onions. This was also served with a side of flour tortilla halves, which I could've done without -- it's better to eat this with the tortilla chips, in my opinion. 

Entree - Street tacos (Al pastor pork): Three individual tacos wrapped in foil and served with a side of chips, all in a bucket -- yeah, a bucket. I appreciate the creative twist in presentation, but a plate would've been practical. The bucket took up too much space on the table, and it's just odd eating from a bucket. Aside from that, the tacos didn't disappoint. 

Overall - Food and service were fine. If I were to return, it would be for happy hour than dinner.

Decided to try Libre for a birthday party. Party of six during Happy Hour. The food was delicious! I had the Chile Tofu Bowl, which was pack with fresh flavor. I would have like a little more sauce, but the flavors were spot on. Others enjoyed their happy hour tacos, quesadillas, and ceviche. I asked them how they liked their food and almost all rated their food either a 4 or 5 out of 5. Some constructive criticism to the waitress and bus workers would be to  ask if the people are done eating before clearing a table. We had two quesadillas and some bean dip left over and it was taken without even being asked if we were done or if we wanted a box. We asked them to leave it and they did, but felt rushed.
Amazing service and kept the consistently coming back to make sure we had a great time at Libre and the food was good as welll.
This is one of the best Mexican food I have tried. The server is very warm and friendly.
This place is so good. $24 all you can eat tacos and tequila Tuesday's. Some of the best street tacos I've had. So good!!!

Went out for dinner with a two of my friends last weekend . And we actually came for the churro ice cream. We obviously expected a wait since it was the weekend but the hottest did offer us to sit in the bar or a text once a table was ready. Opted for text since it's easier but we did try to get seats at the bar section which was full so that option was out. Looking through the menu, all sounded appetizing. Ended up ordering a brown rice bowl with chicken, mango margarita and the churro ice cream. The bowl was decent. The chicken was seasoned but just lacked some flavor. Nor did it offer or the waiter didn't offer any salsa to add more flavor to the dish, sadly. The chicken to rice ratio was off. Had more rice than chicken. The cherry tomatoes was an interesting add and barely an corn in the bowl. Overall the brown rice bowl is fulfilling but the flavors did lack. Along with the mango margarita, I was hoping to get a wow of mango flavor so that was disappointing. For the churro ice cream , presentation and looks good but the textures of the churro was odd for me. It was grainy as if the dough wasn't  cooked all the way. My friends and I agreed that the ice cream part of the churro ice cream was the enjoyable part of it. Would I come back here anytime soon ? Probably not. Okay well maybe trying their other dessert options but we will see ! It's not authentic enough for me perhaps but try it out yourselves . You might probably enjoy it more than I did so cheers !

Ari was our server tonight and he has a great sense of humor!  He has been fast & efficient & has great time management between his tables. 

Food is tasty and the adult beverages are of decent portions.  

Downside:  price to portion is kinda high but not a deterrent. 

I would definitely return and I hope Ari will be our server again.  

:-) 

Updated review 12/28/2017
Manager Xavier took care of us, fast & friendly!!! We ordered the fajitas and thus far the best item on the menu!  My shrimp was buttery & the chicken was flavo

This review is in regards to the AYCE tacos/tequila/margaritas. Vegas itself doesn't compare to Taco Tuesday's in California, but glad to see this place is starting the trend here! I came here for my first time on Taco Tuesday & boy was my assumption right. This place is dangerous! This included chicken, beef, and/or pork options. Since it's ayce, the soft tacos were basic. Nothing crazy We had to request for sour cream, limes, & tomatillo sauce on the side so our tacos weren't so flavorless or dry. Don't forget to request those in order to enhance your meal. The margaritas were chilled & neither on the rocks or frozen. They were strong though. The tequila shots at least came with lime, but no salt. It didn't taste like Jose Cuervo or anything cheap. The tequila earns 4 stars itself in my opinion. I'd say Libres' atmosphere & AYCE special is definitely worth the value. I'd come back for it because I'm a fan of both. I have friends who don't care for tequila so I don't think the $27 tacos would be worth it to them. The tacos start getting more satisfying after a few rounds (haha). One reason why I couldn't give 5 stars is for the super super slow service that night. I felt as if for every one request we had, we had to ask for it twice in order for our female server to remember. She would check on us, but man I don't think she listened well. Make sure you have a DD if you plan on coming here.

Came here on a Thursday night with 2 other people and it was pretty slow therefore we got seated right away, which I liked. Ambiance of the restaurant is very nice, very beautiful venue. We set in one of their booths and it was big and the 3 of us had extra room to move around. Started off with chips and salsa, delicious! I ordered some steak tacos. Quality of the tacos could've been better, but their rice is good and flavorful. Mom and boyfriend were happy with their meals and we ended our meal with a cinnamon churro ice cream sandwich!:) Will be back again.

Love the outdoor patio seating. The main dining
Room is cool putting off a "night on the beach in Mexico" vibe. Taco Tuesday is awesome, $24 for all you can eat tacos and tequila! The tacos were great, the perfect size for a street taco. The margaritas were yummy and not too sweet. The service was great, our server was attentive and fun. The whole staff helped out making sure our table was always taken care of. Overall great place to dine at Red Rock.
This place always has something going on whether it's unlimited Taco and Tequila Tuesdays or Happy Hour, etc! Tacos were delish!

Created by the same company (Clique) that brought Hearthstone and Salute to Red Rock casino, Libre is a decent, if uninspired, Mexican restaurant. I actually prefer its predecessor, Mercadito, to this place. At least Mercadito had a unique variety of tacos. The menu at Libre is more run-of-the-mill Mexican designed to be approachable to the majority of the Summerlin palate. I imagine concepting meetings were filled with decision makers saying, "make it as generic as possible!" If that was the case, they've succeeded. There isn't much that makes Libre special or memorable.

Their appetizers are the only place with a glimmer of originality. The Mexican street corn fritters ($12), in particular, stood out. The deep fried balls had a thick, crunchy exterior covering a mixture of corn and topped with a cotija creme. The crispy taquitos ($11) were executed well, but not much different than what you'd find at any other Mexican restaurant.

Of course, you can't have a Mexican restaurant without fajitas, right? The quality of the steak ($24) they use is rather good and the plating is cool with its mini jars of salsa, sour cream, and cheese. But, the price may lead some to wonder why they didn't go to a neighborhood restaurant instead of one in a casino.

The execution of the food is solid, but the lack of original menu items may lead some to never try them. On the plus side, their menu calls out plenty of vegan items, gluten free dishes, and a kid's menu is available.

All you can eat tequila and tacos!!! Who wouldn't wanna be here!! 24$ cheap and easy all evening! Tacos are amazing drinks keep on coming! Such great quick service for our 40+ party. Coming back here every week!!!

Friendly stuff and very comfortable surroundings.
 
Food was tasty and fresh. 

Prickly pear cocktail was pretty awesome. 

Just a bit over priced.

Omg! I can't believe I never been here before til last night...The rockin shrimp tacos are to die for!! Sooooooooooo good! I'm already craving some more!  The guacamole was good as well and the corn fritters was ok, tres leches cake was ok, cake tasted a lot better the next morning. Can't wait to be back!!!

*All you can eat tacos with tequila/margaritas!!

If you want some tacos and at the same time have unlimited amounts of tequila, come here on Tuesday!

Service is great and they make sure to stay on top of your drinks and not leaving you empty, if you're not carful you're going to leave here messed up lol.

Taco Tuesday is an amazing deal at Libre.  $25 all you can eat tacos and margaritas. Our party of 6 at 6:30pm quickly become a party of 9 within the hour. They accommodated and were friendly to our new friends. Our server and his trainy were awesome. They quickly adapted to our growing party and were still fun  and professional up until the point where one of our guest had an allergy to the food. Before she began eating she asked the server if there were carrots in the food. He said "no". Without even asking the kitchen or a manager. He assured her there were no carrots that would affect her allergy as she explained. After two bites of her steak taco she saw the orange shreds of carrot in the food. She started having reactions immediately. She began scratching her arms and neck. Her throat swelled and her breathing became deep and shallow. We stepped outside and informed the manager as soon as we saw these signs. Red Rock security came to take reports on the situation and AMR came to the rescue confirming it was an allergic reaction. Libre claimed no fault and took no actions to even try to relieve the situation. After about 30 minutes of trying to accommodate for my friends illness we returned inside the restaurant to at least pay our checks. The staff COMPLETELY ignored us and never came back around. INCLUDING the MANAGER! We were polite about the situation not trying to put the blame on anyone. But the amount of disrespect and neglecting the fact of potentially KILLING  someone ment nothing but comping a meal is a joke. Negligent staff and management. I wish I didn't have to say it but they put no effort into helping someone they hurt.
Xavier is an excellent and knowledgeable server! We enjoyed the food and atmosphere at Libre. We will be back!

Went to Red Rock Casino to partake in the May $10 Tuesday buffet but decided the hour wait was way too long for just a few dollars in savings. So we decided to go to Libre to enjoy their Taco and Tequila Tuesday for $24/person. 

Service was excellent from the moment we walked in. The hostesses were friendly, our waiter, Ken, was great and the rest of the staff were very attentive and friendly as well. 

The food was very good too. It's more Tex Mex food as opposed to authentic Mexican food but it was good for what it was. The guacamole was fresh and flavorful and my hubby loved the salsa. The tacos were good too. I preferred the steak tacos with the tequila special but my hubby preferred the chicken. You can interchange between the two if you're doing the special. You can do the same with the tequila shots and margaritas.

Overall it was a fun time. Ken was really great. He was super friendly and attentive. I'd definitely come back and do the taco and tequila special again.

Went in on a Tuesday for the all you can eat/ all you can drink tacos, tequila and margaritas. I'll start off by saying all of the staff was very friendly starting with the hostesses once you walk in. We were seated in a pleasant outdoor section with a rather large group and they still provided solid service. The tacos were dank, the shots were full, margaritas tasted good, not too strong not too weak and left me wanting to come back again!
Great place, good tacos, guacamole, and micheladas. Yummy my daughter got the carnitas and they were amazing. I recommend this place for sure

We went for all you can eat tacos and margaritas/tequila for the 2nd time. First time doing the ACE tacos we enjoyed it and service was great ( I don't have a review for that visit). This last time, not so much. Service was terrible, took forever to get even water. Waiter up sold us on 2 Guacs for the table of 4 adults. Too much if you're getting ACE tacos. Half way through my drink and about 15 minutes later, (so i wasn't gulping them down) I asked for a shot of tequila as my margarita was too sweet, so i was going to add the tequila shot. Was told I had to finish one drink before ordering another. Even when it took him 20 minutes to bring one drink. So how does this make sense? You'd rather me down a drink to get another shot than just bring me a shot, so i can enjoy the drink i already have and you're still brining me the same amount of alcohol you would if i downed it and you brought me a shot. I can see if people are ordering shot after shot, then maybe hold back. But it was my first cocktail, and I'd rather have a stronger, less sweet and take my time than down drink just to get another. And our waitress the first time we went was happy to oblige. I was half way through my drink and she brought me a shot to add to the drink. Simple. Happy customer, good drink, good service = return customer. This time, not so happy, service extremely slow, bad drink = unhappy customer that will not return for the ACE taco Tuesday. Not sure i'll go back for regular menu or not. Guacamole was good though. Tacos ok. I prefer quality over quantity.

Awesome Happy Hour !!!!!! But the staff really makes the difference. It a limited menu but the chicken nacho and the margaritas are 6 bucks. 4 to 6 .  My wife asks for a skinny and they always do it for 6 bucks.

I just had the best tacos ever! I came to Vegas and drove 30 minutes out away to try these tacos on a recommendation. They were as good as advertised!! This restaurant is also well run with a very polite and upbeat staff!! Will come to Libres whenever I come to visit Las Vegas!

Great vibes, great food! Xavier our host was fun and friendly, and had great reccomendations; the chilli rellieno was amazing! We will definitely be back for taco and tequila Tuesday, and more churro ice cream sandwhiches!!!
Garrison is a phenomenal server. Made my cousins birthday amazing!! Thank you Garrison!

Went there again last night for Cosmo Connections. Other then the fact they should have maybe had one or two more servers on deck for the large group, the food is great.

I like sitting outside and the the misting system they have is insane. It keeps the outside area quite cool.

I like the place.

Miss Mercadito. Libre is ok. Not great. Relatively Expensive. $50/pp with drinks. 
Ordered the chicken entree and fajitas. Chicken came out dry and tough. Redo was fine. Fajitas were ok but tortillas dried out very quickly. Charge for additional salsas.

I would actually give it five stars, except my chili Rellenos which was probably $16 was rather small; however, I find the food extremely flavorful. Salsa great in my opinion. I had the vegan chili Rellenos - excellent! The black beans- vegan & super flavorful!I had a margarita with salt - excellent! My friend had the tortilla soup and loved it. He is eating the chicken nachos and enjoying every second. My brother got the flaming fajitas and said while it is not the best he's had - it's very good!!!! We will definitely add it to our repertoire of about five restaurants we cycle. We are picky!!! Tiffany, our waitress is AWESOME! The service generally VERY good!!!!!!!

Great bar at the Red Rocks. Bartenders are super nice and they've got some great specials too. Mondays are $1 tacos, Tuesdays are all you eat tacos and margs for 24 bucks. Plus they love hockey there and had the games on with sound too. Cool place.
A must visit when im in Vegas. Thank you Libre staff for the service you provide and food is always amazingly tasteful
Came here with friends for the all you can eat tacos and tequila staff was very friendly and outside in the prior where we were was really pretty and clean loved it

Went here for National Tequila Day on Sunday July 24th. Special that day: bottomless margaritas for $10. So awesome. We sat at the bar and were greeted with smiles. Lovely staff. Ordered the chips and guacamole which was amazing. However the shrimp ceviche was a bit odd. The portion was very small and instead of regular chips, we got a sweet plantain chip. Wasn't really into it. 

Anyways, nice, clean place with a beautiful terrace and water misters for the hot weather

Meh, the food is just ok. Flavors were all pretty mild, as nothing made me excited for more. We ordered the Carne Asada steak with chimichurri (needed salt, and sauce, but the grill flavor was great) and the $19 Dynamite Rock Shrimp Tacos. 3 itty bitty tacos for $19..not worth it at all. Their cocktails are awesome, so I'd just recommend this place for their happy hour.

Food was outstanding!  Celebrating birthday.  Tostadas, chile relleno, burrito, all fantastic!

Yelp Free Margarita offer kept this from being a 5 star rating!   Free margarita doesn't have to mean the most vile tequila.  Had just had a nice margarita at the bar with Don Julio.  Could NOT even drink the free margarita. 

Come for the great food, forget the Free margarita!!!
Absolutely delicious.  Amazing service.  Gerson was professional, fun, and made it a great dinning experience.  Highly recommended the dynamite shrimp tacos, queso dip, and Cadillac margarita.

We went to check out the new digs at Red Rock since Mercadito left us. Xavier our server was real friendly, helpful with the menu and guided us along the way. We started with the coco shrimp tacos which were small tasted really good and shared some carnitas tacos which came with a nice spicy hot sauce on the side. The Carnitas is prepared over 24 hours and taste did not disappoint whatsoever. The Margaritas were great, the Still water was so smooth and as corny as it sounds you do not want to go back to "regular' water after lol. I would recommend anyone in the area to visit as the staff is on top of it and efficient. Thanks Xavier!

Me and my fiancee have been there plenty of times. Went there on Tuesday.  I ordered taco Tuesday.  Susan order chicken fajitas. Serve was slow for a change. It was busy. My problem when the bill came they changed us for the guacamole for the fajitas.  Wtf!!!! Never been charged for guacamole before. I thought that was cheap and ridiculous. We go to Panchos in down town summerlin.  Portions  are bigger and they don't charge you for guacamole.  Food is not a good though. Stop being so cheap. It's about customer service.  They also don't give you free guacamole for yelp anymore.  Free house margarita. Not so good on taco Tuesday! !!

Great Happy Hour specials. Chicken Nacho's from  the HH menu. Definitely a place to have a margarita and a taco or nacho. The HH nachos are priced great but they are not the same as the standard taco. So if you want lots of filling go off the regular menu.

Clearly old mercadito employees and devotees have nothing better to do than trash a new restaurant that has plenty of potential. Shame on you!  The guac was on point, the ceviche was the best I've ever had, and rice pudding was to die for. Every restaurant has to iron out the kinks in the beginning. Before you give a crappy rating, and if you go to a restaurants opening, go back after a month or two to see if what you don't agree with what has gotten better. It seems to me, people are butt hurt about closing of mercadito (whose drinks outweighed their crappy food tenfold) and not giving the actual food and drinks of libre, a rating that it deserves rather than the tit for tat a la mercadito. Food is great, a great happy hour menu and pricing. All you can eat taco's AND all you can drink tequila on Tuesdays?? Get outta here w the negative crap. Libre is on their game.

Ok, so I'm extremely happy I decided to eat here. First off, I don't care for Mexican food but my gut told me to give this place a try. Since traveling so much for work lately, I haven't had the greatest experience but that's a story for another day. 

So the lowdown. The hostess was super nice and gave options on where I wanted to sit, it's summer, IN VEGAS  and I don't do sum and heat so indoors it is. A booth. I was immediately greeted by my server Jo/Joe. Not sure how he spells it. Good service from the get go. I checked out the menu and noticed some healthy options for myself. Quinoa and cucumber with Apple salad. Amazeballz!!!! I had to ask what this dressing was because it was so yummy! I polished that off. It was Avocado Vinaigrette if you're curious.  Then I ordered a brown rice bowl with well done chicken because I love my chicken well done. Another great choice! I finished all the chicken and most of that too. I wish I had a third stomach. Besides the heat making its way from the patio and making my cold worse, I had such an amazing experience. Will be back very very soon!!!! Thanks Joe and the young man who refilled my water goblet for the strong coffee and the great service.

I think this place is such a great little spot and reasonably priced. It's not the most authentic Mexican food I have ever had but it is flavorful, fresh, and tasty! I look forward to the chips and salsa the most here. The chips taste buttery almost which I'm sure is not good for you but it is so good to you! Then their salsa is just the perfect balance of fresh flavors and slightly with a kick which makes you want more and more. I ordered the restaurant week dinner special for $30 and I got the guacamole as a starter, steak fajitas, and the churro ice cream sandwich for dessert. Great deal and the guacamole is to die for! The touch of cotija cheese on top just makes it that much creamier! I could eat a tub of that daily! Then the steak fajitas come out sizzling and I just love the way it is presented. The fajita plate is placed on a wooden tray with little grooves for 3 separate condiment areas for cheese, sour cream and then the pico, And a side of tortillas. The churro ice cream I thought was ok. The churro has like a vanilla flavoring to it but the ice cream wasn't frozen enough so it basically was a semi cold cream that melted quickly. I think I prefer it on the side next time. We had a nice waiter and the hostesses were pleasant too. Enjoyed my experience and meal and shout out to the bus boys there who refill the water and clear the plates. They are super hard working and on point. Great manners and just make u feel valued as a customer!
Lovely service ... the hostess Regina was a doll! She was very attentive & friendly! Definitely recommend!!

Can Mexican restaurants not course their service properly?  This is the second in two weeks when I was enjoying my appetizer when my main course was brought.  Next time, I'll order my courses separately.

I had a reservation for 5 PM and arrived about 3 minutes early.  I was seated in the section away from the far and closest to the casino.  The artwork of lucha libre wrestlers is quite different and it's colorful even if you don't know what it's about.

I was promptly brought the iced tea I ordered and I studied the menu for a minute or two.  My server, brittany--a delightful woman--came by and asked if I had any questions.  When I asked about the meatballs as an appetizer for one person, she explained that it would be fine.  She showed me the size of the meatballs using her fingers and I went with that.  I ordered the chicken machacados for my main course.

In a short time, a runner brought the meatballs.  As I was eating the second one, another runner came with my main course.  What is wrong with this picture?  I finished the meatballs and then enjoyed the chicken.  The chicken consisted of pounded, grilled chicken breasts with a tomatillo sauce and poblano chilis.  A very flavorful dish.

Lest one think that I was taking so many photos and spending too much time on my phone, here's the data.  I was seated just about 5 PM.  I was finished with my appetizer and main course at 5:23.  That's much too fast.  I don't want to wait a half hour for my food, but with a restaurant that wasn't full and had no waiting line, this was ridiculous.

For dessert--ordered separately after the dishes were cleared--I got the churro ice cream sandwich.  It was made with two pieces of churro with vanilla gelato in the middle.  There was a small container of melted chocolate which made the dessert richer.  It was quite good.

To put the time in context, I had from the above mentioned 5:23 until 5:45 when I left to order my dessert, pay the check, and leave.  There was more time with the last part of the meal than any other time.  It's a shame because the food is good and my server was good.

This is so close to being a 2 star review for the run on service with the appetizer and the main course.  If I come back, I'll order each course separately and space it myself.

Edit:  In my review, I forgot to mention the generous amount of complimentary salsa and chips brought shortly after you're seated in Libre.  I especially liked the wide nature of the bowl of salsa because it makes dipping a chips easy.  It's so much easier than small containers some places use.

Went for Happy Hour which was on point! We use to go to Mercandito and it was less tex-mex and more authentic, however Libre is 100x better.  I LOVE ceviche, grew up in Southern Colorado and it has always been my favorite.  Libre's Ceviche takes me to a Mexican beach with my toes in the sand with hair being lightly brushed by the ocean air. :) It's packed with flavor and all fresh ingredients.   Also try the al pastor tacos AMAZING! 

Certainly coming back and trying the rest of the menu. :)
Joe was great!  Awesome atmosphere and friendly helpful staff.  The Carne Asada burrito was fantastic!  We will be returning to Libres very soon to try more!

Great restaurant right outside Red Rock casino hotel. We had the corn fritters, Mahi Mahi fish fajitas and nachos. Good flavor and okay portions. We weren't that hungry so it was just enough. What made it better was the warm chips and salsa they brought out as soon as we sat down. Even nicer, they refilled it. Would recommend as a great bite to eat. Nice patio seating.

Absolutely a fabulous time here! Kay was our server and she was very attentive and suggestive. Thank you for the upsale to the prickly pear margarita suggestion. Kudos to the whole staff. Although it was a hot June day, we sat outside. With the misters going combined with the energetic music selection; the heat was not even noticed. From the margaritas to the apps and then the sampler, everything was tasty and flavorful.

I really enjoyed dinner here on 4/18/16 with friends. It was a Monday night and not busy at all. We had the option of dining inside or on the patio. The patio is really nice but it was a little chilly so we sat indoors. Great atmosphere whether inside or outside.

I was happy to see a vegan portion of the menu although I did not order from it. Maybe next time! We received our drinks and chips and salsa promptly after we sat down from our friendly, attentive waiter. We also had free guacamole from checking in. All was delicious. When it was time to order entrees, our server was knowledgeable about the menu and had recommendations. Two of us ordered the Achiote Chicken Street Tacos ($14), one ordered the Al Pastor Pork Street Tacos ($16), and one ordered the Breakfast Burrito ($12) with green sauce. Everything was really good. My only complaint is more pickled veggies and lime wedges! I like to load street tacos up with spicy carrots and lime. But no worries, our server brought me out some extra when I asked.

We all left completely stuffed and I even had leftovers. I think the price is fair for a nice, sit-down Mexican dinner. Will be back soon :)
Great happy hour, great food, and amazing margaritas. Thanks Joe for the great service!
Great atmosphere! Mango margarita on point. Really good service. Annnnnd wait-for-it... VEGAN CEVICHE! So much win!

Long night with the homies. Woke up super hungry with. Someone suggested  taco Tuesday and  I'm balling on a budget so we stopped by. Food was on point and so we're the drinks. Service was great. Bartender were awesome.

This place is amazing! The foods so delicious, the tacos are great! Also what my favorite thing about this place is the all you can eat and drink tequila on Tuesdays! I highly recommend going to this place. They have all sorts of tequila as well which I love!
Love the coconut shrimp tacos!  Gerson is the waiter you want to ask for!  Bean and cheese dip is a must too!

What a great little place! Me and 2 other friends went here to kill time before going to the movies. We had our server school us after we asked if they had patron! LoL she smiled and said that patron wasn't a great tequila so she recommended herradura. This tequila was a smooth white tequila that dare I say it??..... was LITT! Super secret pro tip: we all checked in on our yelp apps and got free margarita offers which our server happily honored. We topped off our short drinking session with the sampler and chips and salsa. Everything was great. Overall I'm very satisfied. I normally don't drink tequila but I will be drinking it here. 5 Estrellas out 5! Shout out to our server. Thank you

This was our first time here. We found this place just looking for taco Tuesday. Kat was our server and I'm kindve an asshole with high expectations and everything was flawless. She was very attentive and we never had to ask for refills or more tacos. I was very pleased. Would love to come back.

Came here with friends for the all you can eat taco/all you can drink tequila Tuesday . 

The place is pretty cool looking inside, really modern and colorful. The seating was comfortable, and worked well for small parties. The music and ambience were great, and we could still hear each other. 

As for the food, you have a choice between the chicken or carne asada tacos (no substitutions or alterations, like no onions etc.), but the tequila is limited to the Casa Amigos. The tacos were tasty enough,  but I preferred the asada over the chicken. You start out with 3 of one kind of taco,  then you can order more one at a time. Shots come out consistently, as quickly as you take em. Overall I felt it was a good deal at $24,especially considering the prices of the other foods on the menu 

We had the flan and churro ice cream sandwich for dessert, which after 10 shots of tequila, were amazing! I'm not quite sure how it'd be sober though :/
Great food and the bottomless tequila Tuesdays are a blast! Service is on point. Rock shrimp tacos are a must have.
This place has the best al pastor tacos. The service is great and I have yet to have a bad meal there
Great ambiance and service! Kim is an awesome bartender!  Margaritas are fantastic! Definitely a place to check out at Red Rock.

This is my favorite weekday place!! The shrimp ceviche is my favorite!!! & its on the happy hour menu!! I come here probably once every other week for the margaritas and happy hour deals! Margarita is amazing for such a big size & Kat our server was super nice and on point!! Love this place  not to mention the frosted flake rice pudding my son finished!

My wife and I had date night here last night. It was our first time, and I had it booked marked on Yelp forever! So, I was excited to try this place. 

It was easy to find from the front parking lot. I had made a reservation just in case it got busy on a Saturday night. When we arrived, the hostess greeted us and told us that our table was getting set up so it'll be a few minutes. 

I took off 2 stars because A) the service wasn't all that great B) the food wasn't to exciting either. I say the service wasn't all that great because the hostesses weren't very welcoming. Didn't ask if we've been there before, how our night was going, etc. I've worked at a hotel for 9yrs before and customer service was always top priority. Our server wasn't very enthusiastic either. She had went over two menus. One for the restaurant week that was going on and the original menu. My wife had asked about the restaurant week, what that was all about since we didn't know. Our server didn't give us a very good answer. It was as if she had to give us the menu, but didn't know nor care to know what it was all about. My wife even said after she left "if this menu was to help feed the homeless, don't you think you would be a little more knowledgeable and enthusiastic on selling more of that menu then the original menu?" Since it was going to a good cause. My wife works at a restaurant herself and said she would've put more emphasis on the menu for restaurant week. 

The food came out fairly quick. I was a bit disappointed. It wasn't all that great. Juan's Flaming Fajitas or even Matador is more flavorful than Libres dishes. In my opinion. It was just bland. 

Would I return? Probably not. Or at least I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

The way I know if a mexican restaurant is going to be good....... the salsa!  Libre rocked it.  The salsa flight was delicious and bursting with flavor.  I shared street tacos with a friend and they were fresh, inspired, and totally unexpected for a casino/resort restaurant.  The meat was tender and juicy, with crunches of cabbage and onion, and sauce that was creamy with nice zing.  No this is not traditional mexican food, it's totally elevated without going overboard.  Love it!  This local will be coming back!
I got the burrito - wet and green - not only was it amazing, it was served in no more than 5 minutes!     Great place to eat on the patio with friends!

We thought we would try this place before a movie. We waited about 30 minutes for a table even though there were a lot of open tables. Once we were seated we ordered and food came out extremely fast. We started with gaucamole which was delicious. The chips and salsa was also very good. Other things we ordered were Carne Asada Burrito which comes with a mayo aioli and smothered in a red sauce. My hubby did not like it. The red sauce had too much cinnamon and hated the flavor the aioli gave it. I ordered the chicken taco salad. I was disappointed that it came with no beans so I stole my husbands refried beans, but the salad just didn't hit the spot. My son had the chicken fajitas. He loved them! I would definitely come back and try something new, if not just order appetizers. The service was great. I love that they keep the water full, every sip I took he was back to refill, lol.

Unlimited tacos and drinks on Tuesdays! Count me in! I'm not embarrassed to say it haha
We had beef and chicken tacos, shots and margaritas (heaven)! They pre-make tacos and they give them to you wrapped in foil, so you can't really ask to make them how you want to.
This place is inside the Red Rock casino, great vibes and great service.

We had just arrived at the hotel the day and were too tired to leave and go anywhere so it was complete random luck that we picked this place. It was happy hour so we just sat at the bar and had a bunch of apps. Chicken nachos - yum! Guacamole - yum! Ceviche - yum! And best of all was the pitcher of sangria! That stuff is pretty stiff though because they add brandy too so look out!

We went to Libre on May the 5th. I understand is Cinco De Mayo and is extremely busy at the time, but however I was there to celebrate my birthday and a dear friend's birthday, not for Cinco De Mayo. Not only did we received two phone calls before the reservation and said we'll be charged a 25 for each person if we canceled and on top of the that we had a two hour limit. I never been to an establishment where there was a time frame, I thought that was extremely rude. With that said I expected excellent service. It took us about 20 minutes to received our drinks. Since we had a time frame to leave I thought they would be a little quicker than that. Our server was nice but it took him a long time to get back to the table. The food was excellent that's the reason I gave it 3 stars. When we left the patio is where we sat was completely empty. So my question is why did we have a two hour time frame? My husband and I drop $400 in this establishment. And I couldn't believe the unprofessionalism of Libre. I really enjoy the food. Is probably one of the best Mexican food in Vegas. That's a big deal because I am extremely picky with Mexican food. For those who would like to make a reservation here remember there's 25 cancellation fee for each person and there's a time frame.

I can't recall worse service ever! ! !  That absolute worst. We sat down looking for cocktails and hors d'oeuvres. It was a real struggle to get either. It must have take. 15 minute before our drink order was taken. We started out with guacamole and chips. Good Guac. But we could it get our drinks. Or a napkin or silverware. After asking our waitress twice I finally went to the bar tender and at least got our drinks.  Now she brings the next hors d'oeuvres and still no silverware. We sit there like idiots for another 5/6 minutes and still no fork or knife.  I finally found an adult supervisor who was nice and understanding she did offer to cover the check which nice because by then I was so irritated we walked out and let the food there anyway.  I will NEVER go back.

The food!!!   Their food is great!  Service was excellent!  I had the lunch special - chose 2 steak tacos with rice and beans.  There was a lot of meat, and it was great.  There were 7 of us at the table and we all had something different. Everyone walked away happy, full, and very pleased with the choice of restaurant and the service.  We will be going back!

Came here last night to celebrate our pre-Valentine's dinner.  We had a reservation for 7pm and we were seated even a few minutes earlier.  They didn't have any issue when we asked to be moved to the other table instead of the original one they picked for us.  Our server Jose very attentive, funny and made really delicious suggestions.  For appetizers we had the mini crab ceviche tacos they're to die for ...I could have ordered five of those.  They have three different salsa, all delicious.  Main course had the al pastor pork street tacos.... Very tasty.  Can't wait to try their happy hour next time.

Wow what an experience this was! Watching the flaming fajitas come to the tables to tasting the delicious hand crafted margaritas this was nothing like anything else here at the Red Rock Hotel and Casino. Not only was the Guacamole and salsa made to perfection the chicken tacos wrapped in lettuce was nothing less than perfect. Now you can order all of these things off the menu however your not going to get this experience without the help of Joe! He guided us through the menu and directed our attention to exactly what our taste buds were craving. Funny story my friend even unbuttoned his pants because he was so full and wanted to eat the last taco so all I can say is Joe thank you! What an awesome place to visit and I hope you all enjoy as much as I did!!!

Came in during hh and enjoyed the bean-cheese dip, ceviche, margarita and taco on that menu. Hh dishes and drinks round out to $6 each.  Ordered the lamb dish that came with a thick red sauce. This was not on hh. It was a meaty dish! Also got the yelp check in margarita! Free chips and soupy fresh salsa.

Music is pretty loud here. Ezekiel was a professional server and took care of us.

Mr. Bland had a sweaty and difficult time eating the dishes. I had to add Tabasco to my fork fulls.

Great place for date night. Food was awesome, margaritas are even better. Go for the margarita bowl it's worth the money!! Xavier was a great server made sure everything was always ok. I've been for taco Tuesday before and loved coming on a Wednesday as well.

I come here for an awesome atmosphere, strong drinks and tasty filler food. Chips, guacamole and salsa are bomb so everything else obviously match. I know there are gripes about the pricing, but calm down people, you're in a bar front casino with waterfalls, awesome decor and great service. If you need to focus on the food, you're best visiting the sketchy part of town or a food truck. I need to come back here for their legendary Taco Tuesday experience.  That'll be a good way to jump start the week.

Taco Tues-yaaaaaaaaaay! On Tuesdays, Libre has a deal for $24 all-you-can-eat-and-drink tacos and margaritas/tequila. Your taco choices are chicken and steak. The margaritas are just plain house margaritas. Oh, and yeah, tequila shots!

I think it's a great deal but I honestly got full really quick from the margaritas and tacos. In addition to that, the taco is, at best, decent. I wouldn't come here on a regular day to order the tacos from Libre, but I'll sure as hell eat them since they're included in the Taco Tuesday deal. I definitely think this Taco Tuesday deal is for an excuse to drink moreso than to eat a bunch of tacos.

Although the staff were all very friendly, the service was 3.5/5 at best. The service was a little slow, but moreso, they messed up on the orders quite a bit. I understand that it's AYCE and AYCD, but we kept getting tacos and drinks that we never ordered. We ended up wasting a lot of margaritas and tacos because we just simply never ordered them. 

The patio area is extremely nice. I definitely recommend it when the weather is nice!

I've never even once considered leaving a review for an establishment  based solely on service but considering I wasn't even able to try the food, I decided to make an exception in this case.

First off let me say that I was invited to a Tacos and Tequila event in which we were supposedly able to sample some free tacos. I immediately jumped on the chance to attend because contrary to popular opinion, I actually enjoyed the former restaurant Mercadito and its all you can eat tacos and was excited to finally try the spot that replaced it. 

We waited for exactly an hour and the only thing we got to sample was their water (5 stars for the water by the way, very refreshing) because it was extremely packed and an unorganized mess. It was an every-man-for-himself situation where people fought for tacos. 

Yes it was supposedly free food and generally I wouldn't even bother leaving something negative but when you plan your day around an organized event and you dream of tacos all day long it's kind of hard not to end up disappointed. The nail on the coffin is that the servers kept promising that "more tacos are being made in the back" only to say that after another 40 minutes of waiting that "there will be no more tacos brought out."

All the while this was happening, the management team was blankly staring at all of us optimistic people waiting for what would never come.

In retrospect, it would of just been nice to have a simple notification from the management saying something along the lines of "I'm sorry we didn't anticipate this" or "I'm sorry, there are no more tacos." We would of left disappointed but understanding of what happened and even just dined regularly (oh man was I craving tacos).

Instead, the management, fully aware of those patiently waiting, did nothing but stare at all of us.

1/5 TACO bout terrible management.
Great shrimp Fajitas!  Great service.  Great place to have a nice dinner and catch a game.  Will be back

I couldn't get the episode of Fuller House out of my mind when they went to Lucha Kaboom so when I saw Libre I was drawn to it....subliminal messages lol. I think the art inside of restaurant lured me in too. I have a weakness for themed restaurants.  I wish the waiters and waitresses had outfits to go with the theme of the restaurant.  I think that would be fun! 

We started with the guacamole which is good sized. Then I ordered the shrimp burrito. I liked the sauce in the burrito but I thought there was too much. When I bit into it the sauce came squirting out of  the burrito. It  eventually started breaking apart. I would order it again but see if they can go lighter on the sauce.

We had the Churro ice cream sandwich for dessert. The churro wasn't soft it was hard which made it hard to bite into. Everything else about the dessert was good though!

I have been wanting to try this place for a while. Everything was good, but somehow I was just a hair disappointed.

We used the yelp offer to get a free order of chips & guacamole. The chips were really good. The guacamole was pretty average.

We also got an order of the Mexican Street Corn Fritters. It was one of the menu items that put this place on my radar, so I had really high hopes for them. First, our server warned us that they were more like hushpuppues than fritters, and he was right. Fritters are typically crispy, and these were definitely more doughy/bready. They were a good size and portion. I really enjoyed the cheese sauce they came with, but I really didn't get flavors of street corn...or really much corn flavor for that matter. I think my expectations were too high so I was disappointed. Again, they weren't bad, but they could have been great.

For entrees we had the Carne Asada steak & Carnitas. My husband raved about the Carnitas melting in your mouth. My Carne Asada was, also, tender and cooked nicely. Which was good because they never brought me a steak knife. The grilled onions and peppers on top of the steak had a pickled flavor I wasn't expecting. The chimichurri sauce was really good, too. Both dishes were served with red rice and refried beans.

For dessert we had the Churro Ice Cream Sandwich & the Flan. Both of these were excellent! The best part of the meal.
