Overall, I would give this place a solid C. Not terrible, but nothing outstanding. Just average. I might go again if I was at Red Rock, but I wouldn't drive across town for it. I thought it was a hair pricey for what it was. You could pay half as much at an authentic hole in the wall and have better food. I think that is just typical for casino restaurants, though.

This is one of our favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. The food is absolutely excellent. We like to go there whenever we have time. Try their Tue special: All you can drink (Authentic Margaritas) and soft tacos (Steak or Chicken). It's just so tasty. Even their regular menu, fajitas are just delicious. Their Happy Hour menu worth to try, have lots of good selections, try Chicken Nachos, Guacamole, Shrimp Ceviche, etc. That's not all. You have to personally try it and appreciate it. The service is just excellent, 5 star. We like everybody there. It's just like home. The host greets us, the Manager Brandon and Kay always have their hands on. The servers are professional, we like all of them, Joe, Shane, Kent, Ezra, Michelle, Melonie, too many to name them all. Even the bus boys are good. We like Francisco and Jake. Overall, we just love the restaurant. Highly recommended.

Thought I'd try the new Mexican restaurant at Red Rock. I got there and was promptly seated, the server arrived shortly after, and took my order. 
I ordered the the Carne Asada street tacos ($16) and a frozen Margherita. A few minutes after they brought tortilla chips and salsa. The chips were very thin and broke when you tried to scoop up some salsa. Most were already broken in the can that they place them in. My Margarita arrived and after one sip I almost spit it out. It tasted as if someone used a full cup of Country Time instant lemonade to make the drink . It was putridly SWEET! I tried to get the servers attention, but the Manager arrived first. I asked if I could have a Heineken instead, and they said ok. A few minutes later the server comes back and says sorry, we don't carry Heineken.  REALLY! IN RED ROCK? OK, so I ordered a Pacifico instead. The tacos came at the same time as the beer. There were 3,very small soft tacos with maybe 4 or 5 small cubes of very salty tough beef and very soggy shredded cabbage,placed on a bed of more tortilla chips?? There was a small ramekin of maybe 5 pieces of diced onion and pepper, and another which contained what tasted like Frank's Hot Sauce! 
This meal was the most pathetic example of Mexican food that I have ever ate! I should have went to Rubios in the food court for a much better meal, at a third of the price! They could have at least used beef tenderloin and served it with rice and beans. Also they should have doubled up on the tortillas or used something that wasn't as soggy as the cabbage that they used, the tacos literally fell apart when I picked them up. 
It's really a shame that Station Casinos can't hit the mark with most of their recent restaurant ventures.

Compared to their almost identical restaurant, Borracha at Green Valley, this place just really missed the mark for me. A friend and I came here to watch the Golden Knights game since they had a promotion going on which I saw on Facebook. I initially got a bad impression when we told the hostess we wanted to sit anywhere that we could watch the game and she first placed us facing the opposite way from a TV. 

For food is was just so so for me. We had the chip and salsa to start off and I wasn't loving the flavor of the salsa much, it needed more spice. For an entree I had the Shrimp Ceviche. I liked the uniqueness of the plantains instead of tostadas, but the flavor was just alright. 

Another thing that really bugged me about this place was the fact that their advertisement said free shots of tequila with every vgk goal and when I asked our waitress about it she wasn't even sure of what the promotion was and had to check with the manager. I feel like if you have a promotion running, you should probably be knowledgeable about it and proactive. They also advised that the sound for the game was only available in the bar area which was another thing the hostess left out when she was seating us. 

I don't think I'd come back here again. There's plenty of other Mexican restaurants in the area with better food and better service.

Well, Ill say good bye to one of the funnest restaurants in west LV. Made it a point to get there tonight, the last night, for one more happy hour. Of course tonight it was even better than ever. When we heard Libre was closing at the end of the month we could not believe it. Spent many a night sitting at the indoor/outdoor bar enjoying the great happy hour and superb service, especially from Jonathan. The Libre experience will be sorely missed!

I went with my family right after they opened at around 4:30pm on Sunday, it wasn't busy so we were seated right away. We were served our water before our server even came by, which was interesting because what if I wanted bottled water? Within the next 5 minutes our server Josh greeted the table and gave us time to order. We had chips salsa and guac for the table which I admittedly couldn't get enough of! The guac was tasty and great, it was quality but there are other places I would go to for the price. We order steak enchiladas, carne asada fajitas and a wet carne asada burrito. I personally had the carne asada fajitas and the beef quality was great! It was well-marinated. The presentation of the food was great and the service was good! I'd definitely come back to try the nachos and street tacos!

I went to libre to try their famous all you can drink/eat street tacos and tequila. This deal is only good on Tuesday and it cost $24 dollars. This promo has tons of rules. You can only pick between chicken or steak. Your first order includes 3 tacos and after that, you can only order one at the time. The tequila is delivered as shots. So unless you can handle your alcohol you probably won't be able to have a lot of shots. 
The tacos were surprisingly good. The meat was well seasoned and had a good flavor. 
The establishment had a really good atmosphere. We specially enjoyed the type of music. This is a good place to hang out with friends, specially during the summer time when the patio is open.

Hard to not love $25 tacos and tequila, our server Josh was super outgoing and made sure we had a good time. Margaritas were yummy! We will definitely be returning, on another tacos and tequila Tuesday, tacos were a little too spicy for my mother but I liked it.

All you can eat steak and chicken tacos coupled with all you can drink margaritas/tequila shots. Place is amazing! Ask for Joe's section, he's the man. If you are looking for a hidden gem on Tuesdays, get your butt here between 4-9pm!

Maybe it's the Cinco de Mayo talking, or maybe it's because I can literally walk here from my house, but I love this place.  I've been to Libre twice, once for Tacos and Tequila Tuesday, and once on Cinco de Mayo.  Here is my experience:

Tacos y Tequila Tuesdays: $24 all you can drink tequila and all you can eat tacos.  What? Yes.  I do want to clear some things up though - the all you can drink tequila is just that - tequila shots. Not margaritas, not tequila cocktails, just straight tequila.  It's good tequila - but you've been warned; it can turn into a BIG night fast.  The tacos are delicious (I recommend the steak over the chicken), but I can't really eat more than 3 tacos, so the all you can eat doesn't appeal to me as much as it may to others.  (Ok...that's a lie - I CAN eat more than 3, but I probably shouldn't.)

Cinco de Mayo: We walked right up and got a table on patio. OKAY!! (Lil John not included.)  Granted, they told us we only had 90 minutes, but that worked for our timeline.  We had the house guac and salsa, as well as the chicken fajitas  - all were very tasty!

On to the cocktails: Sangria = a winner. If you've seen any other reviews of mine, you'll know that I love a good Sangria, but I HATE when Sangria is too heavy with juice.  This Sangria was light, flavorful, and refreshing.  EXCELLENT.  Their cocktails are all well-balanced and fresh, nothing tasted overly sweet or overly tart - including Pepino Picante (my favorite - a cucumber marg with a hint of spice), the other spicy cocktail whose name I can't remember, and of course, the Margaritas. 

Definitely check this place out - whether it's for Taco Tuesday or any other day of the week.  It lives up to the hype.  Lastly - THANK YOU Libre for bringing me Margaritas within stumbling distance of my place. :)

Our party of three came here for lunch and two of us had the taco lunch special ( 2 tacos and beans and rice ) and our third person had the fried shrimp appetizer taco. Salsa and guac were good (. Chips a bit salty) and the waitress was a sweetheart

I really enjoyed everything about this restaurant. The food and drinks were great and the service was on point. I had my baby with me and they were very attentive to her needs as well. I am actually going back this weekend for a girls night out. Can't wait to show this place to my friends!
I love this Libre Mexican Cantina! Had sevice beyond perfection. Gerson was so much fun and the food was great!!:) Thank you for such a great evening!

I came here for happy hour with my best friend. They have a really great happy hour with $10 bottomless margaritas from 4-7pm and 50% off appetizers. We had the bean and cheese dip and taquitos. Very delicious. Good service, amazing atmosphere!
Had a great experience! I had a good bartender , very attentive and personable . Great yelp margarita deal ! Thanks ! I'll be back !

The service was great- until he noticed we left him 20% before leaving- maybe he thought he was much better than he was? Up until that moment I was happy with the service. Drinks were good. Food was subpar. What happened to mercadito???
We had the king crab ceviche- more like imitation crab.
The tortilla soup was bland but came recommended.
The tacos were greasy.
I could easily say we will not be back.

I agree that this isn't your typical Mexican food, but the service we experienced was outstanding. It's the best service I've received anywhere in Vegas this year.

I love going to a business of any kind where you can tell they actually value you as a customer. It's so rare these days. At Libre, you feel welcome, and you're completely taken care of. They're not over-solicitous and in your face, but you'll never run out of your beverage of choice, and they will always make sure you've got everything you need and want while dining in their establishment.

As far as the food goes, it is good. It's a little different and definitely not traditional, but the quality is there and if you're open to new experiences in Mexican food, you'll probably like what they have to offer.

The outdoor patio is an excellent choice for dining, weather permitting and if you're so inclined. Give these guys a try next time you're in the area. I think you'll enjoy the experience. :)

For a good time this place would be a great choice. Our server was very friendly and thoughtful. She was bubbly and just a great server all around. Short blond hair girl. She was smart enough to take our orders and would hold the food until our other parties arrived.

 I got a house margarita with the Yelp check in and then got another drink later. We were all surprised at how big the freebie was.

The food was excellent. The only annoying bits were the lights were really dark and the busperson is just really eager to clean the table and remove the plates away. Usually you kind of want to talk awhile too. We had to keep telling him not to take a plate away each time he came. Eventually I just gave up and let him do his job. Goodness. But they always refilled your glasses and I did not have to go thirsty as heck like they sang Trattaoria joint down the block in Summerlin mall.

Walked in at peak hour and went to the bar to wait for our table. The bartender immediately gave us a large bowl of chips and a bucket of salsa, no skimpy measures here. The margaritas we ordered were professionally crafted. My dining partners had the fish tacos and quesadillas and were very happy. I ordered vegan chile rellenos which was very attractive and tasty. My only criticism comes from the vegan nachos. Although vegan, they looked little more than chips with cheese. I'd suggest a sprinkling of enchilada sauce, some sliced olives and sliced jalepenos topped with guacamole or vegan sour cream. Something to make the nachos look inviting, We had great service throughout and the manager even passed through to check on things.

I'd have to say that this place has definitely stepped up their game! I was here right after they opened and had some decent food but the margaritas were sub par. I tried once again the mango margarita and it was delicious! They changed their ingredient profile and made it much more fresh and high class. The chicken taquitos were amazing. Loaded with cheese on top they were just divine. I also received free chips and guacamole with my Yelp check-in which was delicious as well. The guacamole was fresh as was the pico de gallo. It's nice to sit on the patio at night. They turn on the misters which makes it a nice temperature considering it is very hot here in Vegas.

Conveniently located inside Red Rock Casino you will find this little gem. When the weather permits, they have a huge outdoor seating area nearly beside the fountain out front. Because it was chilly, we sat inside.. I found the high top chairs slightly difficult to get into only because I'm incredibly short, but I managed! My husband and I went here to check their happy hour. They were offering $10 bottomless house Margaritas, and were they ever delish! Typically house drinks are made of horrible well liquor and are gross, but that wasn'tthe case here..smooth and tasty! But be careful, that tequila sneaks up on you.. As a Yelp check in, we got a free guacamole...one of the best I've had...really fresh and flavorful. The corn fritters were amazing! The batter isn't at all greasy, it was reminiscent of a holiday corn bread.. Our server was on top of getting our drinks refilled and supplying us with fresh chips. I can't comment on the dinners, we didn't order any. Based on what people around us ordered, all looked good. Next time we'll stay for the main dish fo sho!

A great addition to Red Rock Casino and Summerlin as a whole! The pork carnitas were absolutely incredible and an all around table favorite. Xavier was great and made sure we were taken care of throughout the meal. I would recommend this to anyone in the area and definitely will be back!!
Delicious food and drinks :) I really enjoyed checking this place out. Customer service was great too. A+

Manager is useless.  Before you get the details, let's go through what was done well.

Sitting at the bar. Our bartender is great (long black hair, tall, slim, named Aja/Asia?) and really doing a terrific job to be attentive. 

Our food came out quickly on a Thursday evening (7:30pm).  

Shrimp veracruz has a delicious salad and rice.  There are around 12-15 pieces of midsized shrimp for the order.

The Mahi Mahi fajitas tastes great but there wasn't a lot of fish for $24.  It does not come with rice so you're essentially making your own tacos (grilled Mahi mahi, onions, peppers with jars of Pico de Gallo, fresh sour cream, and shredded cheese).

Male bartender (white button up semi see through short sleeve) was smack talking the female bartender when she stepped away to check on our order.  Not sure why he thought customers sitting in front of him couldn't hear it but he he tried to get the other Asian bartender upset about her leaving her station and leaving him alone etc. Basically they are bro-ing it up behind the bar and talking smack about their coworkers but smile in their face.

Biggest problem, the manager. He has not stopped texting since we've sat down for the past 40mins.  He's not managing his staff, helping serve, or coordinate.  In fact, 40 mins ago, our server asked him to change the channel to the NFL game.  30mins later, when she followed up, he told her "have the customer look up on their phone what channel the game is on and I'll change it."  Um, excuse me!? For a man who hasn't stopped texting on his phone or failing miserably at hitting on his service staff / bartender, he has some galls.

Overall, food is not bad and you're paying a casino premium. Service to the customer is pretty good but their biggest problem is the staff here clearly don't get alone with each other and their conversations as well as disagreements spill over to the customers' experience.  I would implore RRC to come in with better management to get their personnel under control.

I feel like this place is way too overpriced and the quality of the food is just mediocre.

Their drinks are also pretty pricy and not something that I would try again. 

I do have to say they had very good guacamole that I would get again but other than that I wasn't impressed with their food.

I would stick to local places like Taco y Taco who produces better Mexican food.

This place has the best passionfruit margaritas, makes your lips pucker. The vibe here is perfect. Their music playlist was on point. And dinner was amazing. I'd definitely make the trip back to Nevada for this place. Our waiter Oscar was also a cherry on top. He was super attentive and genuinely wanted us to be happy and have a good time.

Honestly- very disappointed.
The waited was awesome, but that's about all I can say was exceptional. 

Firstly- the "immediate service guacamole"-  can taste the processing of it, it's bland, fake tasting and definitely not freshly made-  a good fresh guacamole takes 5-7 minutes to make properly.  This tasted like it was scooped out of a plastic tub from the grocery store.

The mahi mahi tacos I ordered were ok- nothing to get excited about.

My wife ordered steak fajitas- those were actually pretty darn good, very tasty, but had lots of fluid in the skillet with it so the vegetables got soggy after a couple minutes.  Also, their tortillas were not held in a steam pot so wishing a minute of removing from the wrapper they got very hard.

Honestly, for being inside a nice casino in Summerlin, it was a very big disappointment.
Great bar food, with outdoor access.

Tuesday's is Unlimited Tacos, Margaritas and Tequila shots for $24. The tacos are only steak and chicken and they don't accommodate vegetarians in part of the special. Our server said they don't bend the rules for vegans or vegetarians so I was forced to order regular price vegan tacos. 

As far as the service (sitting outside)....our server was super sweet but starting off she was very lagging. She seemed busy b/c we witnessed her running from a table to the inside of the restaurant throughout our entire dining experience until the crowd started to die off.  The drink service was awful. It never lined up simultaneously with our food. We finished our 1st order of chips n salsa, hadn't received our 1st round of drinks, hadn't placed our order yet and considered just leaving. She did say when we were waiting for our 2nd drink order to arrive that the bar was behind but at this time it had cleared out some and we questioned where the drink service was lagging. We stayed to give this place a try and it was just ok

The Libre margarita was very sour, the mushroom tacos were very spicey and his mahi mahi tacos were delicious. Plenty of chips n salsa to fill up on.

It was a different spot to check out and happy we did but we won't hurry back.

I tried this place for the first time, I thought it was pretty bad. The guacamole was sour with no avocado flavor. The Chile Reyenos was deep fried to a deep (too dark), crunchy brown. I took the thick over fried crust off and the flavor was good. The deep fried egg dip on the Chile Reyenos was horrendous. Yet the stuffed Chile part was tasty. The service was friendly and the place wasn't loud which was nice since it was connected to a casino. I won't be back. It was 18.00 for one Chile Reyeno with a half cup of both dried out flavorless beans and ok  Spanish rice. I was disappointed. The buffet would have been a better choice. 

Up date:
The manager was alerted by the waiter because I was not impressed. He said he was going to find out why it was so bad. He came back after trying it and agreed!
He was wonderful. The cook also agreed and it was all taken care of. I was going to give them 2 stars because service was good. However the manager made it right. Because he was so wonderful, he didn't defend the crusty yuck on the plate, he tried it. I appreciated that.

I LOVE Mexican Food and when the New Mexican spot at Red Rock Casino, Libre opened and had Taco Tuesdays, let's go! I had family in town from Los Angeles and we all went last night. $24 AYCE on Taco Tuesday for street tacos (your choice, steak or chicken) and MARGARITAS OR SHOTS! Yasssss! The street tacos were amazing and the drinks were great!!! We will definitely be back and what a deal!

Unlimited Tacos and Tequila is the perfect formula for a hangout spot. Head out and try it on a Tuesday night. The server Katia was absolutely amazing as she was friendly and fun. The room has high energy and there are people constantly touching the table to pick up trash. The location has patio seatings as well as inside. It was very clean and played good music.

The package comes with chicken and steak tacos. We stuck with the steak tacos.

The deal also comes with margaritas which was nice. (This isn't the best tequila so don't expect top shelf for an unlimited deal but it's doesn't affect the fun factor.) The staff will walk around with margaritas pitcher and come by to refill your cup. 

My only tip is to make sure you ask for shots ahead of time because the servers get backed up quickly as the restaurant fills up and you get slower service. Although Katia was amazing and it did not bother us one bit.

I do see myself returning in the future and I recommend that you try it too!

Drinks were good, the tequila Casa Amigos was great and bartender gave us a generous amount in the shot. Had the queso fundido to start with and it was delicious. The guacamole lacked a bit of flavor but it was fresh. My favorite was the chile relleno!!! Loved it !!! Great spot , good ambiance , music needs to be of Latin background . Overall loved this place
Excellent Service, Food & Atmosphere. We had Tacos and the Whole Experience was Stellar. Looking forward to my next time at Libre.

I ate the chicken and shrimp fajitas with flour tortilla and lettuce cups, and it was really good. The guacamole was really good as well. Joseph, our server, was very knowledgeable about the menus and his recommendations were right on.

We came here to what was pretty much an empty restaurant at about 4:00 pm on a friday. We saw on online happy hour menu but the happy hour menu we ordered from was completely different. The chips and salsa were great. Plenty of delicious salsa. We both ordered chicken quesidillas. Food was quick to the table and was just as expected. I had used a Yelp check in offer to claim my free margarita so thank you Libre. I kept looking for the bottomless margarita on the menu. Nowhere to be found. The server was somewhat a mystery. He didnt smile once. He had a full complement of arm tattoos and really had a tough guy persona going on. Almost looked pissed. Not really looking forward to having that guy wait on us again. We love the servers next door at Yardhouse. They remember us and make us feel like family. Not here.

What can I say about Libre... I feel liberated. Move over Taco Bell, there's a new papi in town. Yo quero una margarita y fondito! Me gusta Oscar not the grouch and I want to put him in my pouch. Cinco stars!
Xavier was a very good waiter! Very attentive and kind. 10/10 would recommend. Delicious food as well
Yummy!!!  So much better than its predecessor!  And, the happy hour and Tuesday deals are great too.  Thanks to our great server Xavier!!

Joe and Ken are incredible. Literally incredible. I've been here a few times now for taco/tequila Tuesday and I always have a great time. Ken has been my waiter before and is truly delightful and professional. It's always very busy on Tuesdays and they still find a way to always get us refills and re-orders in a timely manner. This is the first time I've had Joe serve us but he has been excellent. I am so impressed with his ability to multi-task and he has been extremely fun and down to earth. Thank you so much!!!!

This slot in Red Rock sure does change out a lot. And it never really seems to stick. 

With this place, I'd be surprised if it stuck around as well. It's very overpriced for the quality and quantity of food. These are strip prices, even for the drinks. 

It's a cool place with cool decor. The music was all reggae. Which is pretty bizarre. 

We ordered a pitcher of margaritas, which they don't have on the menu. So they charged us for individual ones. They were pretty good. Lots of tequila, if that's what tickles your fancy. 

For the food:

I had the Carne Asada fajitas. They were again, just okay. For paying $24 for about 4-5oz of decent steak is pretty meh. If it was really high-quality meat, I could see the price being reasonable. But they sure did pack on triple the number of onions and peppers. 
The tortillas aren't homemade. 
We also had a shrimp burrito. It's like something you'd get at a fast food place. Nothing worth spending that much for a burrito. It also comes with pre-cooked rice. 
Pre-cooked rice is my nemesis. I don't understand why restaurants use that stuff. It's very displeasing to the taste buds. 

The service was not so great. Our waiter seemed new to waiting. He was not attentive and we kept having to call him over. He forgot so many things. He was nice, but he really didn't seem to care. 
And guess what? Neither do I. NEITHER DO I!

Though I worked very close to Red Rock, tonight was the first time I had the opportunity to visit Libre. It was good. Not the best Mexican cuisine but far from the worst. The complimentary chips were warm and fresh and the salsa was really good too. 

My wife and I share everything so tonight we went with the appetizer sampler. Not a bad take for $18, as pictured. 

Today wasn't a drinking night for me so the free house margarita we earned for checking in will come in handy on the next visit. 

The service was good and the speed was exceptional! If I had to change anything I would have the host person give you menus when being seated as opposed to waiting for your server too and when you ask for water, ice should be a default, especially when it's 113° outside. 

I would come back if I'm ever in the area. They have some stiff competition across the way in Downtown Summerlin via the more polished Panchos Mexican restaurant but Libre is here and ready to rumble on! 

Libre offered me a free margarita though for checking in and Yelping, sooooo thumbs up!

We came here for my son's 5th birthday dinner before heading to Dave & Busters down the way for his party. Xavier was taking care of us and I think he was training someone new that was shadowing him.

We ordered a few drinks and they were great- I had two house margaritas, one to go. The bartender was fast and made them well. I appreciate a margarita that isn't overly sweet. Food wise, we ordered some guac for the table, ceviche, shrimp fajitas, al pastor tacos, mahi mahi tacos and since it was $1 taco night for kids, I ordered him 3 chicken tacos on a corn tortilla.

Everything came out just fine except for my son's order. He didn't get the street tacos as we had ordered and received a kids meal with the rice and on a flour tortilla instead. They were kind enough to fix the mistake and give him a few corn tortillas on the side. No biggie.

I really enjoyed the ceviche and the plantains that came with it as a vehicle- nice change from the usual tortilla chips, although those were delicious as well.

I'm an entire summer late posting this review, oops! I haven't been back yet, but I totally can't wait to hit up their happy hour!

So disappointing, my coworkers decided to meet here for dinner and drinks. I was the first of our party to arrive, so I went to grab a table. I was informed by the hostess that they would seat us, but they were going to "kick us out" at 7:30, in an hour and a half, because there were reservations for some big parties coming in. Conceivable, if the place actually was busy, which it wasn't. The restaurant was mostly vacant, but I guess they like it that way. We took our party down to Yard House (which was PACKED, yet they were still able to accommodate our party) and enjoyed ourselves there. Our team made a verbal agreement that none of the seven of us would ever patronize Libre in the future. Deal. Didn't get to try the food, maybe it's stellar, I'll never know. The hospitality left a bad enough taste in my mouth, it really didn't matter.

We were sad to see Mercadito and it's fun tacos go, so we are glad that Libre is here! Generous potion of delicious guacamole and chips! I did a split of shrimp and mahi mahi fajitas in a lettuce cup instead of tortillas and they were delicious and such a large portion, I couldn't finish! Our server, Autumn, was very friendly, helpful with suggestions and perfectly attentive! We will be back!

Brought some friends for tacos Tuesday AYCE for $24 tacos/margaritas/tequila shots. Our server Joe was so awesome, food and drinks came quick, super friendly and professional. Overall had a good time and will definitely be back.

Since It was Cinco day, took the wife for some good tacos and margaritas.  Libre was the spot.  Tues they have AYCE tacos and margaritas and shots for $25, but sadly It was a Sat afternoon for us.  The margaritas were only $5, but they didn't skimp on the alcohol.  Only complaint we had was that It was served in a plastic cup, and that It took almost 10 mins after we sat to get a menu and some water, and the hostesses didn't seem friendly.  However, the food was pretty good... esp the dynamite shrimp tacos.  They're apps so they're small, about 2 bites per taco, but you get 4 of them.  The flan to finish your meal is a must.   Don't worry that it's small in size, because it's rich like Mark Z.

I like the idea of AYCE and drink tacos, tequila, and margaritas! Too bad I couldn't partake in this offer since I had to study. But everyone else in our party did and at first, the service was awesome, as the server was personable and attentive. Then, we were like, "where is our server?" When you offer things like AYCE and drink, the server should know how essential it is to check on his/her customers often than usual. I'm not sure what got into our server, but he wasn't as friendly towards the end. I ordered the shrimp ceviche tacos (as pictured) and it was delicious! We sat outside and their decor was simple and cute! It's well-kept and clean and it was super busy with birthdays and graduation celebrations! The hostesses were accommodating and understanding with our reservation, and patient as well! I honestly would like to come back for this super legit offer but I'm hoping the service will be consistent! I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. :)

Wow wow wow. ALL VEGANS AND VEGETARIANS, is this your new spot. They have a vegan menu and vegan cheese options. The food and service is amazing. Ask for Chris to be your server. He went above and beyond to get me a vegan street taco off the happy hour menu when they don't usually do that. The chili rellano is amazing and you have to try the ceviche (husband had it )
If you live in summerlin & you are craving mexican, libre is the place to go! Great food and outstanding deserts. They have a great patio and wonderful service. Definitley a place to check out.

Disclosure:  I was a huge fan of Mercadito, stopping by at least once every two weeks. I loved the house-made salsas, the variety of tacos, the cocktails and the service. I wanted to experience Libre with an open mind, but in my first visit tonight, it does not live up to my Mercadito experiences at all. I'm so disappointed that Red Rock chose to mess with a good thing.

Kim was my server at the bar and was great. The rest of the bar staff was nice and accommodating as well, which was good because the kitchen was running really slowly. (I placed an order for cheese enchiladas and still didn't have them 45 minutes later.) The bar staff kept checking on my order and apologizing. They even brought me more chips and salsa. Kim also made me a very nice house margarita. So, even though I miss Gus, Ryan and the Mercadito bar staff big time, this new staff seems to be trying hard.

Chips and the house salsa were fine. It was a chunky type of salsa that had good hints of cilantro, onion and lime. It wasn't much different than the salsa I've had at other fair-to-good Mexican restaurants, but it was tasty. (However, I liked Mercadito's salsas much better.) However, my entree - the cheese enchilada - was another story. The entire plate tasted like it had been drenched in salt, and I'm a person who likes salt. It was so salty that I kept gulping water and couldn't eat it all. I finally realized that the red enchilada sauce drizzled over the top was the culprit. Once I scraped the sauce off, I could at least eat some of the enchilada, but the rice and beans on the plate also tasted like they had been overly salted. The salt in the red sauce on top overpowered the flavor of the cheese and the nice avacado/sour cream sauce that made up part of the dish. I'm not sure if a chef simply had a heavy hand with the salt in the kitchen tonight, or if the salt is part of the normal preparation for this dish, but I know I will not take the chance of ordering it again. 

It looks like Libre has a decent happy hour, and some people around me ordered the shrimp ceviche and liked it. The mini crab tacos also looked flavorful, and I didn't hear anyone near me complaining about them. I'm sure I will go back for drinks and snacks and probably happy hour, but I'll be wary of ordering full entrees for dinner.

Have you read The Onion? This restaurant is totally "Area Mom Hosts Taco Tuesday." 

Disclosure: we were in love with Mercadito. We went often, savoring the taco varieties, the guacamole, and excellent salsas. Mercadito was a tough act to follow. 

And Libre failed. 

The food tastes exactly like the type of Mexican food people try making at home -- or even worse, it's like Taco Bell. Something about the shredded cheese and lettuce tastes incredibly unauthentic. You cannot charge $18 for tacos like this. (At least with Mercadito you had the option of lobster and sea bass)

The guacamole is plain. The chips lackluster (and only filled halfway). Salsas were probably the only halfway decent thing. 

"Traditional tacos" are served with rice and beans. Both sides are disappointing. The rice over salted. The beans an unidentifiable mush. Incredibly annoying: you can't substitute one taco for another, or even flour or corn tortillas. You are committed to your unoriginal, uninspiring plate of tacos. 

It's entirely tragic Libre replaced Mercadito.

Beautifully designed restaurant with amazing energy! There was a group of us that had reservations elsewhere, but decided to stay put and enjoy shenanigans on the patio! We were with a friend who has, MANY food restrictions and another, who was a touch tipsy. Having said that- Jose  (Saturday)& Xavier (the night before) did an EXCEPTIONAL job at keeping us entertained, fed and hydrated. They were  patient, professional and knowledgable of all food/drink recommendations. We look forward to visiting again next year!  Thank you for the amazing service, ambiance, food and love!! This place is definitely a must:)

It was very good! I just came to Vegas for spring break and me and my family hadn't eaten anywhere good yet. The service was great and the food was delicious. The rice bowl with chicken was great and the Mexican street corn (shaved) was quality. We had Oscar as our server and you could tell he was on top of things. Kid friendly, good atmosphere. The bar tender makes a mean margarita! Highly recommend!
Xavier's service was off the chain. Friendly, courteous, and overall made a good experience! Come to Libre

The service here was excellent!  My boyfriend and I came here for dinner, and we were seated almost immediately.  The server checked on us a lot, which I really appreciate!  We had the chips and guacamole to start, which was very yummy.  I think I could've made an entire meal of it (haha!).  I got the tofu brown rice bowl, which was absolutely and incredibly delicious.  I'm a lifelong vegetarian, and a tofu snob; when I say it's good, it's good!  I can't wait to come back here again, the entire experience was wonderful.

Service was super friendly and fast! Food was great ,  I'm vegan so I tried the mushroom tacos and I was very pleased!!!!
Our server was Xavier ans he was really nice and attentive-
I wish they had a vegan desert!

Libre is a Mexican Restaurant located inside Red Rock Resort & Spa. I'll start by saying that the chips and salsa are delicious.
Things you need to try are the Crispy Taquitos, Mini Crab Ceviche Tacos, Shrimp Ceviche, Mexican Street Corn Fritters, all of Street Tacos are good, the Breakfast Burrito is very good, Chicken Enchiladas , Chili Relleno and Slow Roasted Pork Carnitas! They don't have a big following but the Mexican food is above average and should be given a chance. Adios

I'm afraid we were less then satisfied with the food. The dinner salad was flavorless. 
However the service from Zack was very good.

The ambiance of the restaurant is bright and vibrant. Love the luchadors that adorn the walls. The seating is cozy with warm lighting. It is a great spot to come with friends to relax and have some drinks. I really do enjoy the music selection. It is a good mix of 90's rock and I'm down. 

The service here is exceptional. Xavier was a nice balance of professional, informative, and attentive without being overbearing. 

We started off with the guacamole with veggies. I know it is blasphemy to not get chips, but I'm a notorious glutton. I'd rather overindulge and know I had veggies. For our meals, we got the carne asada burrito with the salsa verde and the tostada salad with steak. I could probably have this salad everyday. I wasnt even going to get dessert until I saw the churro ice cream sandwich. I'm sold!
Xavier is amazing. He hooked us up with some bomb food and we had a great time. Go see him and give him a big fat tip!! $$$$$

Always come here for the $24 all you can eat tacos and all you can drink tequila on Tuesday's with big parties and Ezra always takes care of us quickly and he always has a great attitude. Libre is beautiful on the patio and always plays great music.

When I don't come for the Taco Tuesday's I absolutely love the vegan ceviche made with coconut chips. Tastes just like the real thing.

I'm gonna start this review by saying that I was EXTREMELY satisfied with my experience. My fiance and i arrived with some friends for taco tuesday. The staff was very friendly. It's a minimum of 2 hours on all u can eat days but Danielle the manager was very nice and accommodating to where if they weren't busy we could stay a little longer. Katia a.k.a Kat our waitress was on point started with an introduction and then proceeded recommending some of the appetizers which we took her word for it. Suggested that she would start us off with a margarita and a shot of tequilla and samples of all 3 tacos, chicken, steam and pork. Everything was amazing. I felt comfortable and welcomed the moment we stepped in. Upon completing my first margarita I didn't even have to ask for another she was on top of it. As a matter of fact not only was she on top of refilling my drinks and food she remained consistent for everyone at our table with drinks and food. The busser or food runner MARIO that was assisting was very helpful as well. We called Danielle the Manager on duty over to inform her of the amazing service that we experienced she was very thanfull and informative. Like i said over all AMAZING experience I will highly recommend and definitely be back.

Not sure what was better, happy hour or the service. Xavier was on point. He took great care of us, made recommendations and suggestions off the menu and made sure our drinks kept coming. The complimentary chips and salsa were a nice surprise and the food and drinks were satisfying, no need for dinner now! Thanks Xavier!
Food was good but what really made this place worth coming to was our server, his name is Xavier. Get the corn fritters to start it's a awesome dish!

Visited Libre inside Red Rock Resort for dinner and it was amazing. They offer all you can eat and drink tacos and tequila on Tuesday for $24. I don't think you could find a better deal anywhere in Vegas. The street tacos were delicious and I hardly saw the bottom of my shot glass. Our server Alana was very friendly and chatted us up while we enjoyed our tequila. Also I enjoyed the music playlist, and thought the wall art was fantastic! I will definitely be coming back again soon.
Theeeee best happy hour. How can you beat $6 amazing margaritas?? And on Tuesday's? All you can eat tacos and tequila for $24. Def one of our fav spots :)

First time here and all the staff were super friendly. It was $1street taco Monday so tried the pork and porobello. Yum! Also had the guacamole which was nice and fresh. Only complaint was the fact that they cleared the table including our drinks before we were ready to leave so felt rushed and face it people, it's a desert here, leave the drinks.
Excellent Mexican restaurant.  Servers and service are quick and friendly.  Love they have vegan options which are hard to come by.  Prices are good.

The service was a bit slow at the beginning; it was about 5 minutes before we got menus and saw our waitress.  However, she was very attentive thereafter, going over the menu in detail and ultimately ensuring we all enjoyed our meals.  We had house margaritas, which were just fine.  Mine has very strong, so they don't appear to be stingy on the alcohol either.  

As for food:  We started with just chips and salsa.  The salsa was very good.  As for the entrees, I had the child relleno.  It may be one of the best I've had in the valley.  The beans and rice were very good as well.  My wife had the chicken tacos and both my parents had the carne asada tacos. They all had a bit of a kick, but pretty tasty.  I tried a piece of the steak, and it was nice and tender.  All the ingredients were fresh as well.  

All in all, very good experience.

This place has the most horrible customer service I have ever experienced. First off, they held a "Complimentary Tacos & Tequila" event yesterday and it was completely unorganized from the get go. I overheard the hostesses discussing how the restaurant only expected 40 people to show up but there ended up being about 100+ so they did not have enough tacos or drinks for anybody. Mind you, you had to have reserved a ticket ahead of time before attending the event and you would think that they would've looked at the numbers of how many people registered, but I guess they failed to do so. So there was not enough margaritas and tacos for anyone at ALL. 

Second, they completely LIED to everyone there saying "we're making a new batch of tacos and it'll be out soon." Only a handful of people actually got a taco or two and the rest of us were waiting. 30 minutes go by, I already saw many people were leaving but I was hopeful and continued to wait. The event was only for an hour and it started at 6pm so when it came to 6:58pm, we asked a busser to be honest with us and ask are they even bringing out the tacos at all? He said: "Oh no sorry guys we're not bringing out anymore tacos." So they made all these people wait based on a lie, FOR NOTHING? At least have the decency to tell us you don't have enough food for this event you're hosting! 

I understand the event is "free" and we can't really complain, but actually stick to your word if you're gonna host an event that people are expecting something out of it. They also gave actual dine in customers the priority of service and acted like the people at this event were second in customer service. No one came up to our table at all and the hostesses were rude whenever we asked questions. People were complaining and leaving the restaurant upset because there was no sense of direction and professionalism with this restaurant and the fact that they lied and made people wait for nothing makes it so much worse.

Next time they host an event like this, they should actually treat their customers with respect and don't lie to our faces; also they should be more organized and actually have enough food and drinks that people were expecting. This place is ridiculous and their customer service is horrendous.

So, I wanted take my girlfriend out to a nice restaurant. We are both vegan so it's very hard to find food. we really like Red Rock so we checked the menu at all the restaurants there then came across Libre! Holy moly  they actually have a vegan menu! So we get there and the restaurant set up is amazing! There is a variety of good seating. If you want couches they got it, if you want outside seating they got it, bar seating ect. Our service was great especially our waitress and the drinks were amazing! The only reason we are giving it 3 stars is because the food was blah! I got an order of Chile relleno and got only one chile and a mountain of beans WTF and For almost $20! Unacceptable! To the owner I would reccomend for you to spice and season your food. Just give the people what they want. The table next to us even swapped plates with each other because the guy said his food was disgusting. My girlfriend had the tacos and they were a bit lifeless. We so super excited until we tasted the food.   Sorry Libre. We will probably just continue eating at the café or buffet at Red Rock casino.

Great happy hour, good carne asada taco, however the bean & cheese dip was more bean than cheese; beers reasonable / look forward to coming out for dinner to try more // came back and not disappointed by the enchiladas, good stuff!

My family and I had dinner here recently.  We did not have a reservation but we got there before 6pm and they were able to seat us.  Though the hostesses were a bit snooty about it.  Many of the restaurants at Red Rock seem to had snooty hostesses.  Not sure why. It certainly doesn't give a good first impression.

We waited about 15 minutes for a table and got sat to the left of the entrance.  This was perfect as the rest of the restaurant was open to the outside and it was very hot out.  You would have been sweating if you were at the other end.

Our waiter was attentive and came around often. He also brought out menus instead of the hostess doing it.  Not sure I like that as we did sit for a few minutes without them.  The busser kept our water glasses filled and brought chips and salsa quickly  I loved their chips and salsa.  The salsa was flavorful with a little heat but not too hot.  

For entrees, we all had fajitas.  They were served in these long plates which were a bit hard to maunever but the food was great.  Lots of onions and peppers with the meal.  Then sides of sour cream and shredded cheese.  There was choice of flour tortillas, corn tortillas or lettuce wraps.  We all went with flour tortillas.  They were on the smaller side which allowed you to eat more of them.

I had the red wine sangria.  It was tasty but could have been colder.  It actually tasted warm until the ice cubes cooled it off but the flavor was good.

Definitely an upscale Mexican restaurant.  Lots of good options, nice bar area and outside space for the cooler months.

Big time shout out to my new friends Kim, Erik and Jay, who provided an outstanding Taco Tuesday experience to this old goofball at the bar as he sat and watched college hoops! Really enjoyed the tacos and the stiff margaritas!

Had dinner there and it was a mediocre experience overall. They've only been open two weeks, so give this place some time. Service was excellent!

Al Pastor Chicken Burrito: The chicken had little flavor and it comes with filler that resembled cole slaw. Should be called the 'Chicken and Cole Slaw Wrap'. Avoid ordering this until they grasp the concept of Al Pastor and burrito. 

Crispy Dynamite Shrimp Taco: The most expensive appetizer at $19. It's actually comprised of three tacos (plural) and they are the size of Polly Pocket tacos (size of a folded slice of Bologna). Tasted very good though. 

My girlfriend ordered this spicy alcoholic drink served in a martini glass that was about 70% filled.

Highlight of the night was the Salsa Trio. Excellent tastes!

Alana our server was very nice, attentive, and fast.

We went here for date night. I had hoped for more since the atmosphere is really cool. The chips and guacamole (free thanks to a Yelp check-in) were the best part of the meal. I got the carne asada traditional tacos that came with beans and rice and my husband got the carne asada enchiladas. My tacos were alright, but for sure not $16 good. The enchiladas just tasted weird, like they had cinnamon in them. Really. For dessert we had the Tres Leches, and it was very dry, which if you know anything about tres leches, that should never be. It is supposed to be soaked in 3 types of milk. Our waiter was really attentive and good, but he never asked how our meal was, or else I would've been honest and told him it wasn't great. My husband said we aren't going back here again.
Xavier is a great server! He was timely and provided great suggestions. I would absolutely recommend this place.

I hesitated on the yelp review, I dislike not giving a place a few tries first. I thought maybe it was an off-night for the waitress. But then I realized the couple who sat down by us were experiencing the same and this was not out of the ordinary. 

Like them, we waited a bit for our drink orders, then... our drinks. Thankfully we ordered our dinner at that time or I'm afraid it would've been another 10/15 min. After we ordered and had been there for almost 20 min, we were told we'd be getting chips and salsa. Then we got water. (Usually that comes first, but no big deal) after another ten the waitress came by and saw we didn't have chips.. Long story short everything took a ridiculously long time. 

We noticed the couple seated by us consistently looking behind them for their waitress. They too seemed frustrated at the wait for more than one item. It wasn't that busy, in fact we seemed to have a hard time finding any staff at all. 

It was a Friday night we weren't rushing and it was lovely outside, but the experience overall was subpar. The food was ok. Nothing like Mercaditos. 

My biggest frustration was having to eat my rice with chips until it was almost half gone because we couldn't locate any staff who could bring us silverware. If I'm spending $80 for tacos and drinks I want a fork.. 

They also dropped a portion of our side dish on the way to the table and another 15 min later brought back one tiny piece to compensate. No I'm sorry or anything -in fact nothing was said they just dropped the plate off and walked away.. 

The staff we interacted with for the most part were nice, the hostesses were very pleasant. Not enough substance for a return visit. No doubt there's room for improvement in several areas.  :/

Decided to come here since it was cinco de mayo and enjoy some Mexican food and a margarita. They had 5 dollar margaritas and a few happy hour specials. The server seemed a little backed up and the drinks took a little bit to get to us but I do understand since it was a busy evening. We had chips and salsa which were pretty good and salsa wasn't too spicy. We also ordered the chicken fajitas which were my favorite entree. The chicken wasn't dry and came to the table sizzling. I do recommend asking for extra tortillas though. 3 aren't enough. We also had the corn fritters which were ok. For the chips and salsa, fajitas, corn fritters, 2 beers and a margarita it came out to about 50 dollars. Not bad for all that.

I enjoy adding salt to a margarita as much as I enjoy adding salt to a rightfully-deserved negative Yelp review. Unfortunately, I never got the chance to try any margaritas or entrees at Libre, but I already decided that I'll never return to this restaurant after experiencing an unacceptably abysmal lack of service by its staff. 

Three of us waited 20 min (according to Yelp's check in timer) before leaving out of frustration because the drinks we ordered were never made, the chips that the waiter expressly promised to serve in just 2 minutes were never dropped off, and we didn't get an opportunity to order any food items because the waiter ghosted us. 

For entertainment, we got to watch all the nearby tables get their drinks, their food, and their subsequent orders in while our table was continuously overlooked. Perhaps the restaurant was understaffed, but it wasn't very busy either; there were three other occupied patio tables when we took a seat around 4pm. The only helpful staff member was the guy refilling waters; he repeatedly stopped by our table to keep our glasses full. However, this was not enough to stymie the ongoing attrition of our hunger for food, spirits, and the waiter's attention. 

Muy disappointed with the waiter's inexcusable inattentiveness, slow performance, and failure to fulfill even the most basic service tasks; the entire Libre experience was a waste of time that a refund cannot rectify.

Red Rock finally got it right! This location has failed in the past but Libre Cantina is a winner! Came for the all you can eat tacos and drink tequila. Was pleasantly surprised to find generous portions and delicious tacos at a more than reasonable price. Our server was joe, he was super attentive and friendly. The rest of the staff was great too, hostesses were helpful with our baby and stroller situation. We will definitely be back!

Happy hour is boring... Drink options are lame. Nachos were chips with (what tasted like) fake cheese sauce and not much else. The happy hour taco was a sad excuse for a taco.
Shrimp ceviche was okay...kind of bland though. NOT IMPRESSED.

Had a really good meal there last night. The steak fajitas are really good. Our server Joe, who was a great server recommended paying $4 for an extra portion of meat or fish, so we did. The guacamole is also very good. We've been here before and the food was really good then also. We will return as all the staff who waited on us were very good and friendly.

First off, I loved Mercadito and am so bummed it closed.  The service, food & atmosphere was perfect wether you were a local or just visiting.  I wanted to give Libre a shot, and I should've just stayed home.  I sat at the bar (which I normally do) and was so disinterested in the new menu.  I understand they weren't going to be lucky enough to keep their chef, but c'mon!  A little creativity would be appreciated.  I got an appetizer (stale chips) and some tacos.  Tacos were similar to the street tacos you can get on the side of the road- but 10$ more because ... I'm not sure why.  No flavor, nothing special and only made me miss Mercadito more.  I wouldn't recommend going here and I will never go back.  Nothing special, nothing tasty and nothing fun about it.
Me and my husband came here for happy hour on a Saturday night. Service was great and food was good! Servers are friendly and go above and beyond. We will be coming back here!!

I was running late to a friend's dinner and found myself greeted immediately as I came to the table by the our server Xavier. He quickly asked me and girlfriend for our drink orders and was nice enough to give us the menu.
I chose the chicken al pastor burrito and came to regret eating so much chips with guac, salsa and cheese because I would've have liked to make more room got the burrito.
I would definitely recommend and for sure asked to be served by Xavier again.

Delicious Mexican food inside the red rock hotel. Great atmosphere (love the patio) and staff, and delicious margaritas!!!! Love the vegan menu, the coconut ceviche is super refreshing, the nachos are great, and the portobello tacos are juicy and flavorful. Highly recommend for a movie and dinner date night.
Good atmosphere, went on a weekend and it wasn't very busy but staff was nice and we got our feee margarita, which was yummy, by checking in on Yelp! Will come back again. PS great date spot.

I love this place so much! Josh is always my server here and he goes above and beyond to make sure everyone is happy. The food here is amazing. I highly recommend the guacamole and carne asada street tacos. Best happy hour in Vegas by far! 10/10

Very friendly staff. Food was good. I like the atmosphere here. Music is good too. I arrived alone looking to sit are the bar. The bar was packed, I'm not sure if it was the manager I asked if it was ok to grab a table. He right away put one together for me. The resturrant was busy. I think that's amazing custumer service. 5
They always have the BEST house salsa and food! I'm always impressed when I come here. Joseph is an awesome waiter!

Libre has a great special on Tuesday nights. $24 unlimited tacos and tequila OMG!!
Bomb specialcialty cocktails as well. Beautiful patio if you catch a cool night.

Big shoes to fulfill after Mercadito moved out. 

Nothing special about menu and prices leaned towards expensive for a location targeted to locals. Service was worse than average as we often felt like an afterthought. 

Need to try their unlimited taco and margarita night before I draw my final conclusions.

This place was great! I'm glad we tried it. Definitely better than other places in the valley. The food was rich with flavor and the chips and salsa were perfect. Table side guacamole was tasty but could have used more salt for my liking. The taco plate was delicious. I had three steak tacos which were cooked perfectly. My husband had the chili relleno which he said was cooked as it should be. The outer shell was crispy with a flavorful soft, tender and juicy inside. He also had a side of corn which was light and a nice addition to the main dish. I do wish that he menu had more options. For this type of restaurant I think that the items were reasonably priced. Definitely adding this place into the regular rotation of eateries. Also they do have vegetarian options. We finished our meal flan. It was a bit heavier than other flan that I have had but it wasn't too sweet and tasted as flan should. The decor is really neat and the wait staff was attentive and professional at all times. Excellent experience overall.

First I can in alone the host told me we only have bar seats and the bar was full. I came back and she told me the wait is 15 mins. Why is it before she didn't offer me the wait list. She finally seats me it takes 3:32:07 mins for them to bring me a menu but they sat the people after me and they received a menu right away and water. Then the waitress goes to the table and takes there order after me. It take her 9:35:33 minutes to come ask if I want anything I was here before the table next to me but she went to them first. I ordered guacamole and salsa on the menu it says chips or veggies she didn't even ask which I wanted she just rushed by. I ordered my salsa and guacamole before the table next to me they literally ordered there's 3 minutes after me be received it before me mine came a minute later literally a minute. The waitress refuses to check on us she just checked on the table next to me. Still haven't received my ice tea but the next table got their beer. I just talked to the people to the left of me who have finished eating they ordered a beer they say "20" Mins ago and she just brought it. I just got my food and it was chicken instead of steak and shrimp. The salsa here has no flavor. The traditional tacos are bland but I do recommend the sizzling platter the chicken taste better. The steak is to chewy but the shrimp makes up for the steak. I can't find the server to get my check. The server was Cat. I don't recommend her at all. I asked her assistant to get the check Cat comes and asked did I want the check and was I finished. The walks away to go get the check. Comes back to clean off the table and still no check. After asking 3 times I finally get the check while I'm talking to the manager Danielle. I made her aware of that  the server didn't even card my friend.

My family and I went on Saturday evening for dinner, we wanted to sit outside on the great patio but unfortunately the weather was not cooperating! We were seated inside and Garrison waited on us. He was friendly and overall did a great job. The food was great as always! It's a great spot for mexican food and close to home!

I've only ever sat at the bar here and it's always been a great time. The margaritas go down easy, the vibe is cool, and the patio view vibes are strong.

My favorite dish here is the Dynamite Shrimp Tacos. They are served with a jicama *tortilla*. A thinly sliced, cold, and crisp jicama pairs with the warm and tender battered shrimp. The sauce is divine and makes this a no-share dish for me. The guacamole is hit or miss for me - either chunks of avocado or it's mixed until smooth. EIther way, the chips, and salsa are a saving grace.

I have yet to experience the dining room because I'm into the type and level of service I've experienced at the bar.

Oh, and the flan. I'm not worthy! My apologies go to this dessert because I never knew it could be this good. I've always said I don't care much for flan - that was until I had it here. It's creamy and rich, similar to a creme caramel. It's heaven.

Cheers!

This is my second week in a row going to Libre. Both times we have had Michelle who is an excellent server. She has a vast understanding of the menu and has great understanding of detail and customer service. The $25 special all you can eat and drink on Tuesday might be the best happy hour available in Las Vegas and is run by one of the best managers in Young Lee. He not only addresses every table but also cares to learn every customers name. This was an excellent experience I will tell everyone I know as well as continue to keep visiting.

I love sitting on the patio, under the misters at the bar with my girlfriends...the bartenders, Kim & Aisha are super friendly, quick with the drinks and very attentive. The chicken nachos are delicious, the margaritas are just tart enough without sugary sweetness...I love coming here...I've been here several times also for dinner and love the chile rellenos! For dessert my top choice is the warm rice pudding with Frosted Flakes!

For this place, I gotta borrow from some fellow yelpers who nailed it in their reviews!
Strip prices is one accurate comment. Entrees are around $20 and they still charge for chips 'n salsa. Stop the madness! 

The yelp check in offer for guac 'n chips is awesome. The guac is tasty and is a huge serving.
The happy hour $6 margarita is great. Regular prices for margs start at $10. Also on the plus side, I love the patio. The music isn't my taste, but I'm used to that! Patio decor is what I call "Red Rock chic". It's bright, festive and comfortable. 

The misters were going on the patio and the atmosphere was perfect for happy hour and a little beyond. Service was attentive and we didn't have to worry about going thirsty thanks to this! Our server also mentioned the Monday & Friday "extended" happy hour deals from 4-7, which includes bottomless marg's for $10. Sounds worth checking out!
Best traditional Carne Asada tacos I ever had! The rice and beans are good too. Try the guacamolé dip and chips too! Will be trying the fish tacos next time!

Came to Libre for their $24 Taco Tuesday and wasn't the least bit disappointed! It was delicious. My friends and I sat at the bar for this. The restaurant was busy around the time we came at 7, but could find seating for the 3 of us. The tacos came out quick and the bartender was very attentive while being good with other guests as well. Their margaritas were delicious, but our group stuck with cold shots of tequila. This is a great place to come after a long day of work with friends! Will be returning!

Super crappy outdoor service at night, serving and waiting staff need better training for the prices and setting for this place. Food was decent, guava was amazing, drinks were pretty good but there were issues. Disappointing overall!
